Text: The dinner was a private, romantic birthday dinner for my wife and the staff and the food did not disappoint. Cozy table by the window overlooking the Eiffel Tower was awesome! Waiter was excellent and also volunteered to be our photographer. Food was delicious. My wife love it!
Great place for food and drinks . Staff are super friendly. Amazing time !!! Thank you

Llegamos y la cocina estaba cerrada y nos sacaron a las 2 horas
Precio calidad no se justifica

The food and service were both okay. The view of the Eiffel Tower was amazing. All went well throughout our experience until the end when our server brought our check to us. Upon handing over the bill, he knelt down to interrupt our conversation and told my husband and I ‚Äúthis is the bill and it is customary to add a ten to twenty percent tip onto this total.‚Äù It became very awkward and this point and we politely said ‚Äúokay‚Äù and continued our conversation at the table. He then interuppted us again and asked ‚Äúso do you want to add a tip?‚Äù. My husband looked up and said ‚ÄúNo. I do not.‚Äù The waiter then announced for the table to hear ‚Äúok, no tip for this time‚Äù, typed in the final total on his hand held device and hastily handed over the receipt after it printed out. For a restaurant that charges on average $70 per person to eat there, this should not have happened. We felt singled out because we were American. Would this waiter have walked up to a table full of French people and requested a tip? I think not, since it is NOT customary to tip in France. Would not recommend this restaurant if you‚Äôre American.
This place is magic! Food is outstanding and the staff are fantastic. To top it off you have the most gorgeous view of the Eiffel Tower.
Great place to eat, staff where amazing to us, the food was delicious and the atmosphere was amazing.

The cafe offers a superb view of the Eiffel Tower. I booked a table for 3 pm and was disappointed as the kitchen closed at that time. We had dessert and drinks which was a satisfactory compromise. I have a magnificent photograph of my daughter and I beside the Iron Lady so I will cherish that. ü©∑
Excelente, comida, servicio, lugar, la vista !!! Todo muy bien. Costo? Considero un poco alto pero por el lugar,  la vista y calidad de los alimentos , lo amerita.
The staff was phenomenal ‚Äî friendly, welcoming and went out of their way to make us feel at home! The food was delicious and filling! We had a wonderful time in the shadow of the Eiffel Tower!

Ha sido una experiencia incre√≠ble ha superado todas mis expectativas, la comida es maravillosa el servicio de parte de los camareros y recepci√≥n no pod√≠a ser mejor, el equilibrio calidad/ precio puedo decir que tambi√©n est√° bien porque es una experiencia m√°s interesante.
Incredible staff, fantastic service and views sat outside on the terrace. They even offered to heat up our pasta!
Amazing food, superb view, excellent service. Absolutely would recommend! Skip the steak. Everything else is good.
We arrived at the restaurant to be told that they had no knowledge of our booking and they were closed for a private party!
Tout √©tait bon comme d‚Äôhabitude . C‚Äôest toujours une bonne id√©e avec la magnifique vue
Excellent views of the Eiffel Tower. Staff were extremely polite. Cuisine was marvellous.

Perfect location for a view of the eiffel tower from inside the restuaeant, on the patio or outside while you wait for your reso. Ambience inside is romantic. Patio outside is superb. Also place outside to view eiffel head on.

We were absolutely appalled when we arrived after an hour commute to the restaurant to be told or rather shouted at by two extremely rude security men that the restaurant was closed for a private function. They told us there was no manager working that we could speak to which could simply not be true. So at 9:30pm we were left with no restaurant to eat, even after going to the trouble of ringing the restaurant during the day to ask if there was a table which we were told there was, and then booking through open table as advised by the restaurant. What only heightened our disgust and dissatisfaction was the manner in which we were spoken to be security with one shouting at us ‚ÄúI will smash your face‚Äù . All of which was recorded on video. Overall a terrible experience and one I will most definitely share with others planning a trip to Paris.
Seated inside. $50 per person to sit outside. Found out when we arrived. Truffle fries were soggy drenched in oil. Drink glasses smelled horrible.

Beautiful location, good food and vibes overall. We danced until they closed in front of the eiffel tower. What a treat! However was disappointed that the eiffel tower lights turned off 5 minutes after we sat down and that was the main thing we paid for. Apparently it closed an hour early in honor of the Israel, which is understandable and respectable, and something the restaurant doesn‚Äôt have control over.

Another issue- we almost weren‚Äôt allowed in due to ‚Äúdress code‚Äù. We were dressed nicely, nothing over the top fancy but we were wearing a long gold skirt and a black dress, no reason to get dress coded at a restaurant. Eventually he let us in after I already told him I paid $100 on opentable to just sit at the restaurant. (We paid another $180 for our meal)

Anyway, it was a great experience overall and I can‚Äôt complain too much. The staff was super cool other than the bouncer guy. But the experience could have been better due to the things i mentioned.
This place was excellent especially for a last minute reservation since my original plans were canceled!
Very tasty cuisine with a fantastic view. Thank you to American Express for helping me book.
Really nice, great view of the Eiffel Tower. Good food
le service est parfait et nous avions bien diner avec une belle vue
Excelente la ubicaci√≥n la comida la atenci√≥n el precio caro pero lo vale es la segunda vez que voy

Overall it was a very wonderful experience. However, you need to be more specific in your advertising about the 50 Euros per person to sit on the Terrace and what it includes.
We were very surprised to learn that the cost of our food was on top of the 100 Euros per couple to sit on your Terrace. Yes, the view was spectacular, but you really should explain that the cost of the meal is not included!!!

They gave me a 3:30 reservation and at 4:00 they closed the kitchen. I specifically said it was a birthday and I got nothing to show my friend. So embarrassed. Please and confirm they have food before you go there.
WARNING: Infants NOT admitted- although OpenTable clearly says otherwise.  RUDE AND THEY HATE CHILDREN. DO NOT ADVISE
Amazing food and unforgettable view , staff very friendly and welcoming
Amazing views, amazing food, amazing service!! What more could you ask for!!

Don‚Äôt trust open table for booking here. It lets you book for lunch even though they don‚Äôt open for lunch. And for dinner they might just not honor or even tell you that there is a private event. I had dinner reservations and they didn‚Äôt sit me.
Estaba cerrado, abren a las 7 y me dejaron reservar a las 5
Great view and experience. Left my vape and they ‚Äúthrew it away‚Äù üòâüòÇ

Terrible service. Waiter charged a 35 percent service fee on top of the cost of food.
He threw away the itemized receipt. He brought a crumpled up receipt.
We checked the bill and realized we were overcharged.
He then gave us cash back for the service charge.
It was a terrible experience

Will never return

Everything was exceptional, the Food, Service, Ambience. They played music that I loved. The people were nice, the staff was great. I give this place a 100/10. When I visit Paris again, I would def come back here
They charge you 50 each if you want to seat in the terrace with a view of the Eiffel Tower, thats about all they have a view, everything else is not worth it!
Tr√®s bon restaurant avec une vue magnifique sur la Tour Eiffel. Serveur sympathique et aux petits soins. La cuisine est tr√®s bonne. Nous reviendrons lors d‚Äôun autre s√©jour √† Paris.
fantastic views of tower Eiffel! No kid's menu but children loved French fries.
Best romantic place for a romantic date in Paris.
Was great experience, good service and amazing food

There is a dress code that is not mentioned on open table. Apparently men are not allowed to wear shorts, that said my son had to go back to the hotel, which was a 40 minute round-trip to change from shorts to pants. What is most disconcerting is that two other male patrons entered the restaurant wearing shorts while we were dining. Obviously a double standard. When we complained to one of the managers about this slight, she did apologize profusely and offered us a free dessert. At least the dessert paid for half of the Uber rides my son had to pay for. The $50 dollars per person extra surcharge to sit on the patio to view the Eiffel Tower is obstructed by a very large statue on the patio. The food was mediocre at best. I‚Äôve had better at other much cheaper French cafes. ÔøºService was typical French slow, but we had to ask for mineral water and more champagne many times before it finally arrived. One surprise is that when my wife mentioned she was cold, they brought her a very nice blanket. The one and a half hour time limit to sit on the patio isn‚Äôt really enforced Ôøº as I saw many patrons dine outdoors for two hours or more including my table. Overall, I think you can find other French restaurants which are worth your time. I personally would cross this off my list and wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place to my worst enemy. Ôøº

The dinner was a private, romantic birthday dinner for my wife and the staff and the food did not disappoint. Cozy table by the window overlooking the Eiffel Tower was awesome! Waiter was excellent and also volunteered to be our photographer. Food was delicious. My wife love it!
Great place for food and drinks . Staff are super friendly. Amazing time !!! Thank you

Simply Beautiful!! We spent an amazing time with you guys!

What a fantastic experience! Stunning views of the Eiffel Tower from the terrace, with an attentive and welcoming staff. The food was exquisite, one of the highlights being the veal carpaccio. Highly recommend.
Merci √† tous!
We really enjoyed our time and the staff were lovely. The views were amazing, food was delicious and we would definitely go again.
Got there and restaurant was closed for renovations. Open table should not be accepting reservations for this restaurant
Very beautiful best diner I‚Äôve had in France by far
Experience was amazing-including the service! The food was good not great but the location made up for anything the food lacked.

Perfecta no creo exista un mejor lugar en Paris para cenar disfrutando la imponente torre y sus luces .
Me encanto
Wonderful staff and excellent food. We had our three kids with us and they took great care of us all. The view is unmatched. All of the food was excellent.

Front row location to observe the Eiffel Tower.  The terrace has an ultra lounge vibe and dim light ambiance‚Äôs. At 11pm, when the tower lights began to sparkle, there is no better place.

I had the truffle pasta and my wife enjoyed the beef tenderloin.  Excellent place to enjoy a bottle of wine or champagne.   Have your camera handy!

Staff was incredibly rude, after having a reservation they informed us upon arrival it was 50 per person to sit on the terrace. The man rudely stated in the reservation it states that, which it did not. I had two children with me so why would I pay that for a glass of champagne and outdoors when I was going to pay to eat. However directly next door they have a wonderful restaurant Girafe with exceptional people and free outdoor seating with the same view.
Extremely well placed but food portions too small and very expensive for just a view on the Eiffel Tower

Great food. Great view. Tables are extremely close to each other.
I brought my kids and Unfortunately the table next to us kept smoking and made my kids sick.
I wish there was more room or they could have put us in one of the alone tables for better experience. Bill was over $500.00 but only thing we would change would be table placement.

Une catastrophe
Des voleurs faire payer 50‚Ç¨ par personne le fait d √™tre en terrasse ajouter √† des tarifs d√©j√† √©lev√©s pour des portions minuscules
A fuir
Dans les plus branches et les plus chics restaurants de paris personne n √† cette pratique de bandit
an absolute must if ur visiting Paris!! Incredible views, food, service!!

I had a fabulous experience there for dinner last night while traveling solo and wanted a special experience. Can‚Äôt speak highly enough about the service, wine and food. Two things to know: 1 if you want the fantastic terrace view seating, there is a ‚Ç¨50 charge (includes champagne) AND 2 regardless of what open table says, you need to CALL the restaurant to confirm your reservation and seating request. I did this and had no issues and reiterate a great experience. I even got to compliment the head chefs when they came out to thank me for dining. Two other notes: the DJ gets fairly loud the later it gets and pay attention to sunset times if you want to see the tower sparkle‚Ä¶my 8:30pm rez in July was not late enough for the full effect (first twinkle at 11pm) can‚Äôt wait to go back on my next visit!

Best view at terrace for efil tower
James manager  is superman , stylish ,  with 5 star service and rest of staff amazing too.

Great location  üí´üí´üí´üí´üí´üí´

It is a spectacular view. Do not plan to eat there. Expect that the hostess will tell you you failed to book the open table booking properly, but know I know you did! I would not recommend open table permits them to use their service. They are not to be trusted. Food adequate. View spectacular. Just have a glass of wine, enjoy the Eiffel Tower, and don‚Äôt add on a tip
Great food, view and overall experience. Highly recommend!

I was really impressed.  As a wine professional, I eat and drink at fancy venues all over the world.... Cafe de L'Homme should pat themselves on the back... a great experience.  

First - the wines we carefully selected and there were both some nice referrences and a bunch of good wines and very reasonsable prices... I loved my J.M.  Boillot Montagny 1er Cru 2020 - around 95 Euro... it was fantastic.  The 2012 Chateau Carbonnier blanc was awesome with the carpaccio and the richer dishes we had.  

The menu is well designed - with a great selection of items. 

The venue is beautiful and both the management and the floor staff have great enthusiasm and customer service.   

I was also able to get a table last minute but I don't think that will happen next time - this place is sensational....

Great Job - 5 stars

Cannot even rate because the day we booked, June 21st, the restaurant was holding a private event but did not contact us at any point to let us know that we could not attend our reservation. We booked this reservation over a month in advance and when we arrived at the door, a very rude security informed us that a private event was being held and that our reservation was void. Thankfully another lovely restaurant in the area provided amazing service and food.

DO NOT PAY FOR THE EXPERIENCE. They will tell you the outdoor patio is closed and then begin to seat others outside saying they paid more than you. When we went we were surrounded by the rest of the American tourists that were told the patio was closed even though we all paid to sit outside while they sat locals outside. Avoid at all costs. Not worth the money. Much better food at much better prices with amazing views all over Paris.

Was looking forward to this so much on my trip to Paris. It‚Äôs a beautiful restaurant/view. I made a reservation long in advance, confirmed via email 24 hrs before. I showed up, and it was closed for a private party. They were apologetic, but why didn‚Äôt they call or text to let me know?? Big letdown as all of the other rooftops in the area had no reservations left.

Just left this restaurant‚Ä¶. I don‚Äôt like to write reviews but I just had to for this place. Yes the view is beautiful but that‚Äôs where it stops. The waiter was incredibly rude like WOW. I‚Äôve never experienced that in my life. Literally was arguing with us when he got my mother in laws order wrong. They made us do a prix menu because we were a party of eight. All the food was terrible. I‚Äôve never had such bad risotto in my life. It had no flavor and just full of green beans. That was it! I don‚Äôt even think it had cheese at all either. It was really expensive for the food choices and on top of that, they make you pay an extra $50 per person to sit outside. That‚Äôs crazy. Definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this restaurant to anyone ever! Hope this helps someone learn from our mistakes.
The view is amazing, beautiful setting. Was a great family place for a Sunday afternoon

Just like others, who reviewed, we received a number of emails and calls to not only confirm the reservation but also to confirm that we reserved Terrace seating. We of course confirmed and appreciated the follow-ups. When we arrived we were told that we did not make reservations for the Terrace when we booked. We started to remind them about the multiple confirmation emails and calls, but then decided it wasn‚Äôt worth the hassle and we sat inside.

Our waitress was super pleasant and we genuinely enjoyed her skillful hospitality. Unfortunately, we cannot say the same for all the staff members, including a rather rude Terrace manager. We politely asked our waitress if it was possible to take photos outside on the Terrace, and she immediately recommended the most advantageous angle. We walked out onto the Terrace and were immediately stopped by the Terrace manager who told us that we are not able to take pictures at the recommended angle. We did not protest and left the restaurant after settling our bill.

Food was okay, but nothing special. Save your money and engage a photographer for a personal photo shoot.

Open table and this restaurant are not communicating. We had a table booked and confirmed on open table, arrived at the restaurant and it wasn‚Äôt even open for 2 more hours and had no booking for us at all. Restaurant even admitted that they have this issue regularly with open table.  Both the restaurant and Open table need to sort it out.
Awful way to treat customers.
They were closed. I should have known when so many people mentioned issues with bookings that it was not worth the time.
Wonderful view and great food! The atmosphere was amazing and great service. We will come again next time we are in Paris. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è

This place has an amazing view. The food is good, the service is a little slow which we did not mind because we were there for the experience. We where there at 8 pm and stay till 10:30 or so and saw the lights come on at the Eiffel Tower. They had live music and we had an awesome night!

Do not go here,
Firstly they couldn‚Äôt find are reservation even tho we booked weeks in advance and replied to the numerous message they sent to confirm which triggered off the continuous hostile environment it is,
The tables are so close together you might aswell be sitting on one continuous table, no privacy or relaxation - which caused the accident of a split drink on the floor and then manager or whatever he was ,was standing there giving dirty looks talking in french then came over and complained of how much the floor cost? Then said it wasnt he fault the drink split and then continued to spray whatever the cleaning product it was right next to us as we was eating, which he ended up spraying on my shoe , then suggested I deliberately put my foot in it? Why would I do that, 
Food was awful 
Service was awful
How they got the cheek to call that a high class restaurant is beyond me, 
Would highly recommend noone to go here,
Gorgeous view and delicious food. I think the terrace charge was worth it. Overall, this was a great experience and would recommend it anybody.

The steak was dry
Don‚Äôt order the tuna belly
But the ambience and service were good
Made a reservation on this app for a Monday and the restaurant is closed on Mondays. I hope I will not get charged.
Lindo lugar, lo mejor, las vistas a la Torre Eiffel, poder estar en la terraza en un d√≠a soledades privilegiado

They were great at acknowledging our special occasion. Offered us one of the best views from the restaurant. We actually had a choice between two tables. The view is truly amazing. The food was all perfectly prepared to savor all the intended chef intentions.

Disappointing... As a formal wine country resident, I've been a lot of semi-formal  no course meal required. I asked them for the better seat, and they told me I can have 110 euro meal seat. So I said yes. Well, it did not worth to pay a penny more for that spot. You will see why from my pics. The next problem is service. When my mom and I were hesitating to have course meal table, because of the view. I could tell one server was very annoyed. He said "Madame, oh please, please" What do you expect from me? when I could not get the table which I requested 5 days ahead, and confirmed 3 days ahead. Plus, when I pay more than $100, I don't expect servers to kick my chair while they are serving me. Also  my server started taking food away from me without asking. "Well" he asked, but his hand was on my plate already when he asked.
I honestly did not believe all the bad reviews. But here I am. People, PLEASE DON'T GO. SAVE YOUR $$$$$$$$$$$$$$

The view outside of the Eiffel Tower was of course spectacular: and so close! My boyfriend "popped the question" that evening, and it was an unforgettable evening for us. However: the food was not adjusted to the environment: the potato flakes blew off the plates, and glasses broke around us continuously as the location can be windy and there were no wind breakers. There were heaters but it was nonetheless a bit of a challenge. We are adventurous people and appreciated the view of the Eiffel Tower, so we could not be persuaded to move back indoors for shelter. The interior of the restaurant was OK, but no view of the Eiffel Tower from inside sadly. Also: the staff was rather chaotic, we were not confident that they had things under control. And upon request to take pictures of us/film us on that unique moment of getting engaged...ALL photos were blurry and ruined....waiter: please make sure you know how to use a phone. The food was nice, but could be improved (ratio of bread and gooseliver pate, potato flakes when it's very windy outside, the food was cooled off in no time, etc.). However,this was our special night and the decor was very spectacular and overall the staff were friendly and obliging and doing their best to give us a special experience. We can laugh about it still, and will never forget this special evening for us.

i specifically asked for a table in front of the eiffel tower, and the waitress/lady who took care of coats and reservations didn‚Äôt even care to see if there was any table available (the restaurant was empty), said she didn‚Äôt care about my reasons and that the table i was the one and if we didn‚Äôt want it, we could leave.

Lovely food, beautiful setting and atmosphere! It‚Äôs such a pity we were slapped with a ‚Ç¨150 additional charge on top of our bill for simply sitting in the restaurant. We booked Cafe de l'homme after watching World Cup coverage this summer and decided it would be a fun and fancy treat. I made a reservation for noon on a Wednesday which is when multiple websites list them as opening. We arrived to the restaurant a few minutes before noon and had to wait until they started letting people in at 12:20. It was quite annoying and I'm not sure the reason for the delay. Once we sat down around 12:30 I realized the view and the terrace itself were both beautiful, the weather was perfect so we lucked out. However, with the umbrellas up for shade, the view of the top of the Eiffel Tower was blocked. This was the whole reason we chose to eat here, but what we could see what still very nice. My husband and I ordered lunch and drinks and everything was very tasty. We were pleased with the food even though the portions were on the smaller side. At the end of our lunch we noticed the $7 charge for our water which was quite absurd. Lastly, while paying the bill, the waiter asked right in front of us how much we would want to tip him so that he could complete the payment. This was awkward and seemed unprofessional. Overall, I know we were paying for a fancy lunch with a nice view which is what we got.

They do not tell you that you have to pay 50euros per person for the view outside. So that was a great surprise at the end of a wonderful meal. 
I can understand the charge for the view but to not know about it while just blissfully sitting there for dinner. 
When we tried to ask about the policy and the fact that we did not know about the extra charge the manager came over and was very short with us and demanded to know who the hostess was who took us to our seats. Once he found out he said he doesn‚Äôt know if there is anything he could do since we already paid. So he took down our number and email to have the corporate team contact us the next day. It has been over a week and we have no email call or message from them. We are no longer in the country so that makes it hard to get ahold of them but just seems two faced when the manager says they can take care of it the next day and then we don‚Äôt get any for of communication.
They charge for the view, 50 euros per person. Its  ridiculous . Service is too slow. Food is good but it arrives cold.

El ambiente estaba muy bien, la vista al Torre Eiffel espectacular, hay muy bien servicio m√°s la comida no me pareci√≥ que tenga la calidad como para ese lugar.

I was at Cafe de L'homme for my fiancee's birthday. I chose it because it has a reputation for having a show-stopper view of the Eiffel Tower combined with a high-end food/service.

Both the interior and exterior spaces are very sophisticated. We sat on the outdoor patio, where the proximity to the Eiffel Tower *would* make for a great view... however, not all seats/tables are created equal. Some are fairly obstructed by the massive statue in the center of the patio, while others like ours could not see part of the Tower because of shade umbrellas over the tables. It would have been nice if, on a clear night like ours was, the restaurant would have closed up the umbrellas to allow patrons to have an unobstructed view. Because they weren't, people like us had to get up to see or take photos of the Tower, which often meant standing next to other people's tables to do so, something I'm sure was a distraction to those other patrons. Given that there is a 50 Euro fee pp to sit on the patio (which to be fair, did come with a glass of champagne and an amuse bouche), it would have been nice to have the umbrellas down for a more unobstructed view.

As for the food, it was above average, though not necessarily outstanding. I enjoyed the escargot, which was presented well and were large and numerous. My salmon was also large and cooked perfectly. My fiancee had a tuna tartare as an entree and a decently sized filet (6.5 oz.) which was nicely cooked as her main. However the desserts were a bit underwhelming. The creme brulee came with no fresh fruit, and when she ordered fruit as a side (for 2 Euro), it came as a sauce, not actual pieces of fruit.

All told I would recommend Cafe de L'homme to others if you are able to get there early and get a choice seat on the patio, but set your expectations appropriately regarding views, food and service. In my experience it was above average, but not the finest dining experience I've ever had.

Obviously you go to this spot for the view of the Eiffel tower first, it's just sublim and wonderful. The prices are on the high end as you can expect, but I found the food just good, not amazing. There could be some improvement there, as well as on the decor which I just needs some update. Now that they have a strong competitor nearby (Girafe), they need to step up their game for sure. Overall a good experience nevertheless.

I saw she was very overwhelmed by the number of tables she had, so I couldn't fault her for that, however getting anything else ordered, a refill on your glass or even the check took an incredible amount of time. It took so long that we had to skip out on desert and ask for the check because our next reservation was upon us. The service was not on par with the dine dining experience I was expecting. We asked for blankets and didn‚Äôt get them until right before we left...saying that they had sent them to cleaners. If I were operating the place, I‚Äôd make sure you have enough to support to outdoor tables available. 

They tried to make it up to us by giving us a glass of sparking wine at the end of the evening but it wasn‚Äôt enough to satisfy us.

Its located inside the Mus√©e de l'Homme. Nicely furnished, however they forgot to include a toilet inside the restaurant, so guests have to use the museum toilet - weird.

 Amazing view of the Eiffel Tower, would only recommend going when the weather is nice if not you will end up sitting inside. Without the amazing view of the Eiffel Tower pretty just another over priced restaurant in Paris.

Caf√© de l‚ÄôHomme is a beautiful room with an astounding view of the Eiffel Tower. The service was excellent, warm, and hospitable. The food was fresh and perfectly prepared. Don‚Äôt hesitate on this one. It‚Äôs awesome.

I had dinner tonight with a colleague who is also visiting Paris. We had an amazing time at Cafe de l'Homme.  The food was delicious. Incredible experience at Cafe de l'homme.  My wife and I were connecting through Paris heading back to the US on her birthday after spending a week in the UK and our flight was cancelled, leaving us with a spontaneous night in Paris. We were so late coming from the opera right before closing and they still let us in and were so polite and kind, great staff, good food, but the view is obviously the best‚Äîif you know Paris then you know this place and nothing is better than sitting down right in front with the Eiffel Tower as the background. One of the best places to take friends visiting the city or just to grab a drink with friends

We arrived early which was good as they didn‚Äôt have our booking but thankfully they had a table. Unfortunately the Camembert came cold as seemed like it had been sat out for a while. Great experience! super friendly owner and staff.

Fair prices and good atmosphere we really enjoyed our time.
Thank you!

Our initial experience at this Parisian restaurant was a pleasant surprise.

Food was average and overcooked. Felt like a tourist spot. Baked Camembert was nice. Ribs, burger and garlic toast all overcooked and not worth the price.
Super repas au Sacr√© Frenchy, la nourriture est d√©licieuse et le service est excellent. Je recommande chaudement.

Initial impressions were poor. It was a 'rugby' Saturday and we were lucky to get a booking. At first the staff appeared confused and disinterested but suddenly a table appeared and they swung into action. Good, efficicent service after that and the food- albeit simple - was good. Good prices too. I would go back,
Everyone was so nice the food was so great. The piano player was amazing (had a front row seat). I had a wonderful dinner and a wonderful time. Ôøº
Customer service was fair. unfortunately, every item that we ordered was very unpleasant.  The quality of the food was horrible and health concerning.
Great food, fun vibes, great waiter, good wine! Enjoyable and highly suggested!

When we showed up, they handed us menus instead of the experience. We actually preferred this and didn‚Äôt ask about the experience.

We had the foie gras and escargot as appetizers. Our first time trying both. Both were delicious, but we preferred the snails slightly more. The snails had a pesto seasoning. For our main course we had the duck and lamb shanks. Once again both were fantastic. To finish it off we had the chocolate and caramel dessert.

They made a big deal about how everything was homemade. Supposedly Paris has a lot of restaurants that just reheat stuff, this want one of them.

On Saturdays after 8, they had a pianist playing modern pop songs that provides lovely background music. Only speaking English was not a problem.
Super restaurant with great service in a great location!

Ate at 5pm on a weekday; unsure if the kitchen staff were rotating or if the senior guys were taking a break but the food was poorly cooked. Kids meal - chicken dry and fries awful (almost burnt on the outside but slightly undercooked on the inside). Croquettes lukewarm, but the rest of the food was fine but average for the price.

Service was good; great staff. Probably rated better as a bar than for its food.
Everything was amazing - from the food to the service to the ambiance. Our server was friendly and welcoming. The lamb shank was incredible! It was my favorite meal in Paris.

I reserved a table here for my first dinner in France. It was the perfect start to my trip after 26 hours of travel. The food was sublime and my waiter was so kind, attentive and generous. He gave me a great table despite me being by myself. The lamb was the best I've ever had. Highly recommend this place!
Wonderful experience and great food. Friendly waiter. Only complaint, it was in the high 80s outside and there was minimal air conditioning inside.

The food was incredible. I had the lamb it‚Äôs the best lamb I‚Äôd ever tasted. Our waiter was amazing. Gave us a complimentary drink as it was my sisters birthday. I highly recommended this restaurant
Food was really good, escargot was amazing one of the best I‚Äôve had
Best dinner i had with my wife for our anniversary staff super friendly and offered prosecco and great service
Staff was super friendly and happy to accommodate us! They even brought my sister champagne for her birthday!
Friendly staff.  I ordered lamb.  It‚Äôs was too dry and lack of flavor.

Delicious food, friendly helpful service, we had such a wonderful dinner! I highly recommend the onion soup au gratin, the duck breast, and the chef‚Äôs ceviche! And don‚Äôt forget to get an espresso with some cr√®me br√ªl√©e for dessert
The best service I‚Äôve ever received in Paris. We came for dinner and the your men and lady working here were superb. Price was great. Quality of the food good for the price.

Perhaps the experience would have been different outside, but the inside of this restaurant was dark, stuffy and felt rather unclean.  Our server was a very pleasant and sweet young man, but his efforts were not enough to overcome the atmosphere and mediocre food we were presented with, after having been rather curtly dispatched to  the back corner of the restaurant when we arrived.  There are too many nicer restaurants, in better parts of Paris, to even consider going to this place.
One of my favorite restaurants every time I visit Paris. The service is friendly and the French food is superb, complete with classic dishes
good atmosphere and nice dinner with friends.

I expected better, given the Chef's credentials. Terrible experience. The bone marrow was flaky and hard. The lasagna was dry. The steak (for two) appeared to have been reheated (at least once but possibly more). Would not recommend it. Service was ok. The ambiance was ok. The location was good.
Wow! First day in Paris we had dinner here. The food was fantastic and the service was great. They even had live music! Definitely recommend.
The service was fantastic, the food was good but simple.

Why are the ratings so high here? The high rating was misleading. Unfortunately I chose this restaurant because of the ratings for a large party family dinner while we were all visiting Paris. The waiter was somewhat friendly being very direct when someone ordered an appetizer and the waiter restaurant said ‚Äúwe are taking drink orders not food orders.‚Äù   The restaurant had no air conditioning it was stuffy and hot on a summer evening. The food came and wow what a disappointment. Some of us ordered lasagna and it was dry and crumble like with chewy lasagna noodles.
I was excited to bring the family here based on reviews but that was misleading because there was ‚Äúno experience‚Äù other than average service and poor quality food.
The food and staff make this place super special. Thank you for helping us celebrate my daughters birthday.
It was one of the most memorable places we ate at while on vacation.  Would recommend.   Might should check your bill though.  Ours was wrong.  Could have been a honest mistake.
Amazing service and they made the night enjoyable for the kids!

Lovely lunch here and so appreciate the fine staff. The only downside is its location in the main street where the noise of honking horns and sirens affected our dining experience! Maybe add some partitions to block the sounds.
1/2 chicken was phenomenal, smoked salmon was a hit, beef cutlet was soft enough to cut with a butter knife, and the service towards my family and child was above and beyond.

Nice place and very good service. The waiter tried his best, although was stressed due to more work. He could have saved time and energy just to be a bit more relaxed. Food was great, just onion soop could have been more seasoned.

Came here for my last dinner in Paris before heading back to CA. We wanted a very french evening and Sacre Frenchy did not disappoint Alex took great care of us.
Great experience! Staff was extremely helpful, quick, and very friendly. Highly recommend picking up the foie gras and octopus as appetizers!
Had an amazing waiter, and the food was absolutely incredible!

Very slow.  Questionable quality.    No repeat.

We were visiting Paris for 2 weeks and choose this restaurant based on our larger party of exchange students visiting from several countries. Our servers were fantastic! Servicex, food and atmosphere was great!! I would certainly go back

Arrived to celebrate Betty‚Äôs 95 birthday.  Our party was met by the staff and it was beautiful how they treated us.  We were at a table of 4, in a quite area of the restaurant and after we were seated  a glass of champagne arrived along with a treat.

We all ordered our food and while waiting for it to be prepared a candelabra with 3 lit candles arrived for a most pleasant surprise to our evening.  Our food started to arrive and it was like an orchestrated symphony!!!  Each dish was precisely timed so that we had time to not only enjoy our plates but was able to share everyone‚Äôs too.  It was a magical experience that the entire staff made specially for Betty.

Upon our leaving the manager stopped the live musicians and the entire restaurant sang Happy Birthday and once again another glass of champagne accompanied by sparklers!!

I simply can not express the love that Betty felt from the staff but also the restaurant patrons who welcomed her 95 birthday.  Betty came to Paris to not only celebrate her 95 but to be here in Paris for 30 days to check another ‚Äòbucket list‚Äô item off.  She still has more to go I can assure you!!

Sacre Frenchy! is not only a great place to dine but the entire staff makes you feel like your home!!

First outing in Paris and very good atmosphere with a good dinner with friends.

Professional lunch, classic menu with an attractive price. Amazing

Our waitress was a complete MESS! Instead of taking orders on paper, she chose mental memory which didn‚Äôt work out at all. After waiting over an hour for our appetizer, she asked us to repeat our order so she could check in the kitchen. We were confused because our order should be inputted in their system being that she proclaimed to put them in. Nevertheless, we waited another 20 mins for the appetizers to arrive. Not once did she check to see if we needed a refill, being that we now have been waiting for 1 1/2. After two hours‚Ä¶ and no entree, I politely reminded her that we yet to eat. She acknowledged and rattled off an excuse. We witnessed everyone who sat
In her section experiencing the same low quality of service and we all discussed our frustration. When I finally was given my steak (which she ensured me was a filet, but was most definitely not) it was rubber and I couldn‚Äôt even chew it. All the while, the manger sees this chaos and just doesn‚Äôt correct the problem. I was beyond my breaking point. This was my worse dinner experience while in Paris. I walked out hungry and disappointed.

Terrible service, the worst I've had in a long time.  We were at our table for almost 2 hours and received 3 visits from our server, only 3.  #1 hello after 20 minutes with an apology for the delay and said she would be back.  #2 took our drink order. #3 delivering our drinks and took our food order.  The kitchen delivered our food.  That was it. No check on our food, no additional drinks, just terrible.  Got up and asked for our check, and stood at the front area to get our bill paid and asked for our remaining food to be take-away.  15 minutes and no boxes. Got up and asked for boxes, she took our plates from the table and ended up dropping one of the plates with all the food on the floor.  We left in shock.
Don‚Äôt be fooled by the humorous name, this is a high end restaurant with great food and attentive waitstaff. The service was a little slow, but above par in general. Highly recommend.

We spent valentines dinner here and it was an amazing experience! The specialized menu was delicious, the ambience was romantic, but the staff were the absolute best! They made us feel so comfortable and welcomed. Highly recommend and we will definitely be back!

Sacre Frenchy was fantastic! My girlfriend and I went for her birthday and we‚Äôre greeted with a flute of champagne! The waiter was lovely and gave us plenty of space. We ordered the French onion soup as an appetizer, which was excellent. One of the best I have ever had. I got the 8h lamb and mash, which was outstanding if you can handle rich foods. She got the vegetarian lasagna, which was very good but had a very tough shell on top. Neither of us were able to cut through it without feeling like we were going to shatter the plate. Despite this, the interior was a tasty vegetable medley. We then ordered the cr√®me br√ªl√©e, which came out with a sparkler and a song! It was such a wonderful night of food, wine, and conversation. I would highly recommend Sacre Frenchy to anyone visiting Paris.

Charming and romantic place. Excellent service and superb food. Definitely will be back.
Great French Resturant, good food, staff was nice, had a lot of option for kids as well. Really enjoyed it.
It was a great experience for our family! A must go for our next trip to Paris.

Overall good food! Steak was amazing and cooked to perfection, the fries were okay, generous portion but overcooked. Lemon meringue tart was delicious and a perfect end to the meal! 

Nice location, exceptional staff and beautiful atmosphere.
Had a great evening, the food is traditional French food, great atmosphere, live music. It was busy but we were looked after!

In Paris for a friend‚Äôs birthday. Had been before and had a great time so felt like a safe bet. Menu was reduced and options not as great. Think we may have ordered badly but would think twice about going back. Service was friendly and efficient and the restaurant had a nice atmosphere though so maybe worth another try!
Wanted to try a good Escargot and French onion soup; this place did not disappoint. We loved it! We last minute decided to get Cr√®me br√ªl√©e and it was an amazing delicious decision.
Great food and best service. Everyone was friendly and the food was delicious and reasonably priced

Wow!  What an experience!  The food was so delicious and honestly we could have spent the entire day and evening making our way through the portions.  Such a cute place and we had the best table in the house.  Service was a little slow, but it

Very nice place where we had a great time with friends and family in Paris!
Many French specialties with fresh products. I just ate too much ;)

I made a booking on the day - my daughter and I visiting Paris for the first time. Restaurant was a good 30 min away from the hotel so we have already spend money on the taxi only to be greeted by the rudest man on the planet to tell us he knows nothing about the booking as he does not check his online bookings. After making faces he gave us a table next to the piano with the speaker right into our ears, but I was glad we were not going to have to go back hungry. After another 20 min of making faces, he sent the waiter to TELL us we had to move to the corner table as the table was obviously booked. 
As you'd expect, we have left and shared experience with our hotel who promised to share it with their guests. And I will be sharing this with anyone I know. The only rude person we have encountered on our trip works at this restaurant.
Food was fresh and tasty! Service a bit slow but still great when interacted. Piano player and singing was an excellent touch!
Welcoming environment and staff. Great drinks and food. Very Frenchy! Loved it
Food was fantastic. We had the French onion soup, foie gras, and magret, all of which we thoroughly enjoyed. Live music from the piano player made for a great atmosphere.
The service was great and there was a beautiful ambience with a man playing the piano. We made a reservation of 9 for a birthday celebration and all had a lovely time!

Fabulous dining room and warmth.

Pleasantly surprised by this place. Friendly and helpful staff, lovely food and drink, and overall great experience. Would definitely visit again next time I am in Paris.

food was exactly what we expected - so beautiful and full of flavour. The service was attentive and bespoke. It‚Äôs all we wanted from a Parisienne experience as tourists!

Let me first say people who gave this establishment one or two stars suffer from a black heart. There can be no actual justification for such a bad review. Not only was my experience contrary to that review this restaurant opened in June of 2020 and is still around.  Any restaurant that opened in the height of COVID and still survives is a quality establishment 

As for my experience  we were warmly welcomed upon arrival. Our waitress, Auda, was wonderful, she was warm and attentive, the food , lamb chops and beef were very good. I have nothing to complain about.  The atmosphere was fun and the piano player made the night complete.  Yes there were smokers outside, Parisian love to smoke, they are everyone. But that did not take anything away from our experience. If we make it back to Paris we will definitely come back and I highly recommend eating here.
Great bistro setting. Food was great and our waitress went above and beyond with not only our meal but helping us to get a cab off a busy Paris street.  We will definitely go back!!
Outstanding service. Went above and beyond for us and the family. Great experience.
Charming service and delicious food.

The service was extremely slow, even by European standards. We had two appetizers and a drink, and we were still there for over three hours. We tried to flag our server down to even get more water and couldn't do that.

Let‚Äôs start with the first impression: a noisy lounge-like ambience with patio smokers surrounding the entrance; the sound of ‚ÄúAmerican rock classics by piano‚Äù wafting through the front door. This could be fun, if not completely contrary to the website‚Äôs description of a Michelin chef‚Äôs reinvented fever dream (the exclamation point should have been a red flag on fire). Overcrowded, understaffed, we were shuffled to a barely lit corner of the restaurant to be tossed menus without any word from the waitstaff before they quickly ran off to the demands of another table. Soon after, the ma√Ætre d brought us a candelabra (a nice touch, admittedly) before scurrying off hurriedly. My gorgeous dinner guest and I laughed it off before gazing at the menu and we immediately realized our mistake to see a list of food items commonly found within √éle-de-France somehow Americanized, described in terms more common √† l'anglaise. We ordered the Burgundy snails and received dried, overly cooked earthworms encased in fragile pouches (half of which were so baked they couldn‚Äôt be extracted from their shells). After waiting nearly a half hour for our waitstaff to return, we then ordered a cheese board which, to be fair, is hard to flub up before we both agreed to forego the main course and, instead, concentrated on our mediocre bottle of vin rouge, the pianissimo tunes of Elton John twinkling in the background. We soon left for another meal elsewhere after etching our initials into the waxed candelabra, sauntering into the night Parisian air a bit wiser in the world‚Äôs ways.
Absolutely incredible

This meal was our only bad meal in Paris, and it was hilariously bad. We found this place on TripAdvisor and they had wonderful reviews and gorgeous pictures, so we were really excited. For our main course, we ordered the butchers daily beef, medium rare, with peppercorn sauce  - sounded like a great steak au poive to us! When the meal arrived, we were presented with three skewers of small beef cubes, all cooked well done. Not what we were expecting at all! We ate the meal, the fries were decent, but we were disappointed. To top the meal off, we decided to skip dessert, but were offered some Calvados, an Apple brandy from Normandy. We thought this may be a sweet nice dessert, but it was basically cheap tequila. We laughed through the disappointment, and left to get dessert elsewhere. All in all, felt like a tourist trap with overpriced, not great food. Definitely felt bamboozled by the TripAdvisor page and I‚Äôd warn others to be wary of what they read!

On vacation. A waitress came by and said I will be right with you. She then walked by our table 7-8 times over the next 15 minutes never stopping even though we called out to her several times. The manager came and took our drink orders then another waitress took our food orders Food was Ok. When it was time to pay the waitress made a several mistakes with the bill. Booked on a Saturday for something to eat in Paris having had a few days of wonderful food. 

The restaurant had a live singer who was great and created a great atmosphere to eat in. However, the food was really bad and did not seem fresh. We ordered a few ‚ÄòFrench tapas‚Äô bits (calamari, croquettes and tomatoes and Parma ham on toast) to start. The croquettes were nice but the calamari was exceptionally chewy and the Parma ham was completely tasteless. We chalked this up to a few mistakes and moved onto our mains.

I ordered the ribs from the rotisserie menu. The meat was decent but was served with chips that tasted like they had been sitting for quite sometime before serving. However, my partner ordered the burger which after one bite she immediately stop eating and said it tasted bad. I then also tried it and was immediately hit by flavourless beef which was then replaced by the very unpleasant taste of rancid beef fat which I imagine came from an unclean grill. This put myself and my partner off all of our food and we asked for the bill immediately. We raised this and were offered another burger but the taste had put both of us off our food. We asked for the bill from which the burger had been removed but the food experience had been awful from start to finish which was a shame as the food in Paris is generally at a very good level!

I visited on Thursday 21st October for my birthday as well as my girlfriends birthday and the service we received was the best I‚Äôve ever had! From the minute we stepped into the restaurant we were treated like family, from being seated at a beautiful table with candles to even having our very own teddy bear joining us for dinner. The champagne was exquisite, the food the best I‚Äôve ever had. We had the cheese board to start and it was so tasty, then I had the soy-sauce duck for main and it was incredible, so delicate and the sweet potato was cooked to perfection. My girlfriend had rack of lamb and it was falling off the bone it was so tasty! Once we had finished our meal we finished off our champagne and had some cocktails, and then one of the waiters came over and gave us a birthday shot of French tequila as a farewell. Then we had a pianist playing songs for us before we left for the Moulin Rouge. I would rate this place 1000/10 ‚Äî so worth the money and for the staff, I cannot wait to come back ‚ù§Ô∏è thank you so much!

We celebrated our 23rd anniversary sitting outside on a beautiful Paris evening at The Nellu. The Nellu was a culinary delight from start to finish. The chef is top notch and so creative. We loved the 5 fromages, which was out of this world, followed by the artichoke dish and pollock which were both works of culinary art. Our waiter could not have been nicer and recommended the perfect champagne and was so knowledgeable. He even ran a couple of blocks to give me my phone, which I had left on the table. The Nellu is a must and is in a very fun part of town as well. We will be back!

I‚Äôve had the good fortune to travel the world and eat some great food which also means I can be quite critical. This experience, and I use the word intentionally, was nothing short of amazing. The food was just awesome, the flavours they pack into their dishes are very refined, extremely well balanced and equally daring. Adding caviar and salmon roe to a hollandaise over asparagus, the kick of heat on the Korean beef tartare without numbing your palate, the theatre of the dancing Katsuobushi on the mussels risotto, and the intensity of flavour in pressed beef shoulder with a rhubarb sauce .. just amazing. A calm, unassuming decor, 20 or so seats inside, a small but attentive team. Can not fault this!! 2 courses, without wine, ‚Ç¨50pp is great value!!

Our server was the highlight. So nice and spoke some English which helped as well. Our appetizers were the Ceviche and the Beef with Teriyaki and both were very good. I tried the Bordeaux wine and the Pinot Noir and was not impressed with either. We both ordered the Grilled Rib Steak (Medium-Rare) and substituted for truffle potatoes instead of fries. They came out so Blue (deep dark red inside) I think they cooked it for 30 seconds on each side. We sent them both back and they came back Rare (arguably still less than rare) I had to send mine back again to finally get a medium rare/medium finish but that was rather pointless because the meat had zero flavor whatsoever. It took 2 minutes to chew one piece. You get some sauces to dip in which helps with the lack of flavor but the chewiness was exhausting. This is not what I expected for 44 Euro‚Äôs. It was a piece of cheap meat with chunks of fat attached all over. I can buy the cheapest steak at the grocery store and do infinitely better. They did give us a free dessert which was nice since we really didn‚Äôt eat our main course together and ended up being there much longer with the multiple re-cooks. Would‚Äôve been better to have removed my steak from the bill at that point.

Indeed, they lied to us and said that they had not included a service charge. That, if true, would be a violation of French law. Dessert choices were mediocre. We had saved some red wine to enjoy with a cheese plate, but they said that they had run out of cheese (even though we were early diners.) Ridiculous! They could have restocked by purchasing some right in the neighborhood. The dessert we finally, reluctantly, chose was a heavy, thick, and poorly tasting tiramisu. The exact opposite of a good one. This unsatisfactory meal did not deserve a ‚Äútip‚Äù. And we resented being lied to and taken for fools.

Don‚Äôt judge a book by its cover applies well for this restaurant. We consider ourselves huge foodies, always looking for off the beaten path gems, and staying away from overly recommended and popular Paris restaurants. We were attracted to L‚Äôempire du 8‚Äôeme by its menu online and immediately made a reservation, which was last minute as we had unexpected changes in plans. At first the atmosphere worried us, as it felt more casual and what most would consider high end, but we were quickly blown away by the incredible service, impeccable plating, flavors and presentation in each dish. It turned out to be one of the best restaurants we went to in Paris! The food was prepared perfectly and the balance of flavors and ingredients was very impressive. I would not miss this restaurant if you like Mediterranean-esque cuisine. If you have a larger party, the cellar downstairs has an incredible atmosphere for an intimate group gathering.

We ate lunch at L'Empire du 8√®me on Christmas Day.  The food was very flavorful:  shrimp risotto, lamb curry and scallops in lobster sauce.  Delicious--we mopped up the sauces with their wonderful baguette.  Entree of fois gras was the best I've ever had.  We shared a buche de noel which was in a pool of anglaise sauce--lovely.

Oh, what a night! Unable to get into Septime for our one night layover in Paris ‚Äî the night did not disappoint. We arrived too late to go to many restaurants and did not want to sit on top of a lady at the bar at L‚ÄôAtellier Joel Robuchon, so we searched for an alternative. Everything on Yelp was closed as per usual since COVID wrecked the world. Thanks to Open Table we happened upon L‚ÄôEmpire and made our resie! From the moment we walked in the door to the time we left this was nothing short of one-of-those magical evenings in your life. We were greeted with a genuine smile and taken to the best seat in the house ‚Äî the corner table. Soon after, we met the lovely and knowledgeable Vanessa, our server / undercover sommelier. She introduced us to a lovely new white, Condrieu. She helped us order a near perfect meal. We started with the escargot, of course and a Caesar salad. Both were delicious! She earned major points when she realized everything we ordered was seafood and Caesar salads in Paris always come with chicken. She also saw our Open Table profile noting the pescatarian/vegetarian preference. Thank you, Open Table and thank you, Vanessa for catching that. Hubby‚Äôs Octopus was OUTSTANDING‚Äî wow!!! But, aside from the beautiful presentation by another wonderful server/staff member, the taste of the Sole was underwhelming. For the most expensive item on the menu, I hoped for more flavor, but it was light and fine. The sides were INCREDIBLE. We had the truffle mash (note there is a 5Euro up charge that I didn‚Äôt catch on the menu) and the fries. I will dream of both of them. We were too full for dessert, so we had the cheese to go and enjoyed it this morning from our hotel room. It was also divine and a perfect French breakfast! Aside from this spectacular meal, the staff and especially Vanessa are worth the visit. She is one of those beautiful, well-traveled old souls who lights up the room, makes you feel welcome and loves FOOD & WINE as much as YOU do!

The service was exemplary. I had the octopus and my date had the beef fillet. They were both better than the equivalents we‚Äôd had earlier in the week. The escargot presentation was unique, in my relatively limited experience, but excellent. Highly recommend.

We were visiting Paris for the weekend from London and looking for something classy, fun, with good food and not too expensive on our first night. L‚ÄôEmpire did not disappoint. We had the rib stake sharing platter, green beans and fries for a main (they even made them truffle fries for us as an off the menu request), and had the amazing chocolate cake for dessert. Everything was cooked wonderfully, flavourful and fresh. You may have to wait a little while for the courses but it‚Äôs worth it for the freshly cooked meals. The service was amazing and everyone so friendly. The host Youseff in particular took care of us and even treated us to a shot at the bar.  We were made to feel very welcome. The ambience is great too with mood lighting and a live DJ playing urban music on a Friday night. Highly recommend !

I came to Paris with a large team of colleagues and with 24 hours notice booked L‚ÄôEmpire for dinner on a Friday night. I originally thought we would be 15 people- so the very nice staff offered me the private room‚Ä¶ then around 30 people from my team turned up! The staff were so nice to us despite our poor organisation- the food was great, and the private room was perfect for a large group. Merci bien!
It‚Äôs a very cosy restaurant. Food is great. Thanks
Amazing food and service.  And thanks for the warm welcome for our birthday
Excellent. Everything was great
Amazing diner. Very cozy mood with exquisite food and amazing staff and music.  A place to be to have a good and fun dinner
Had a great lunch. One of the best octopus I‚Äôve ever had. And the cookie dessert is for the charts
The ceviche was absolutely exquisite, as well as the chateaubriand. Nice wine selection as well.
The host brought us to the table , then the waiter gave us some great advices, the food was excellent as well as the cocktails
Good but not ‚Äògreat‚Äô food. There are bistros that are way better, but this place has the intimacy aspect down.
Formidable restaurant. I came to eat within the hour, I stayed almost 3. Delicious.
Amazing food, and even more superb services.  Thanks
Food was really good, creative. The waiting staff however were not really interested in taking care of us even if the place was not busy at all.
I came for a lunch near the Champs Elys√©es. Left very surprised. It was fantastic.
Great place and food to celebrate our son's graduation.

Absolutely fabulous! Upon arrival we we're greeted with complimentary champagne. All of the food dishes were amazing especially the octopus. When we left they even gave us two complimentary shots. The service was fantastic!
Amazing food , great service and extra welcoming host.
I was there for a special occasion and they didn‚Äôt ask why, they didn‚Äôt try to make it so risk and it was okay.  The food was great though!
Amazing lunch. Superb service. I will definitely recommend and come again
Very cosy atmosph√®re, music , and exquisite food
Great service and fantastic food
Will definitely come again.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Je suis d√©j√† venu plusieurs fois, je n'ai jamais √©t√© d√©√ßu, les plats sont bons, l'endroit est impeccable, le service est extr√™mement attentif, d√©licat et tr√®s gentil, on s'entend parler

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: I was so happy to eat at another Jean-Georges restaurant this time in Paris.  It did not disappoint!!  Good meal and service.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Merci pour ces 4 soir√©es/diners nous √©tions tr√®s contents comme d‚Äôhabitude. √Ä bient√¥t David S√©bastien

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Excellent food.  Restaurant very understaffed, perhaps because during first week of the year?   Not the level of attentiveness required for a restaurant of this caliber.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
We enjoyed dinner on 12/28 so much we returned on 1/2.  A repeat performance.

Wine, drinks, food and service were great.

Place not to be missed.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: I liked the food here, nothing different or amazing but good quality food for a pretty good price. Service was good and the staff were friendly.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: needs to up date with the location and high standar

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Our waiter was sick and sneezed near
Us several times.  Our wine order was forgotten. The food was inconsistent - raviolis and pizza were delicious but chicken was tough and beef was completely raw in places- but cooked perfectly in others. Samosas were incredible. The only other thing was that the waiter asked if we wanted to tip when we were told service was already included so that was a bit confusing. The staff was friendly.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Everything on the black plate was delicious. The service was great. Be sure to order sides.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Hello, the food was exceptional, but we had a reservation and it still took hours to give us a table, hours for them to take our food order.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
They were severely understaffed: took us 45 minutes to get the champagne we ordered and even then we had to call. We arrived at the restaurant at 9 pm, our reservation and left at 11:50‚Ä¶
Food was excellent and the manager very gracious, they could not find the wine we ordered so instead gave us a very good magnum.
We know Jean=Georges from the US., food is excellent, and overall it was a good experience albeit somewhat slow: decor was nice, music (DJ) good but for the price we paid we certainly deserved better service.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Absolute worst experience on New Year‚Äôs Eve. Poor service, timing on everything was off. Waited 45 minutes at our table after being seated to order a beverage and order dinner.  Had to ask repeatedly just for knife to cut steak, by time it finally arrived- meal was cold.  Certain dishes never even showed up! So some of us ate while the others sat there with nothing.  Drinks ordered never arrived. We left after three awful hours as we couldn‚Äôt bare it much longer. Two of the four left first because it was just awful.  Never even saw dessert, my husband and so tried waiting but eventually gave up.  Trying to get anyone to get our bill (essentially for nothing) was an obstacle.  We went to coat check and left.  Will need to pay over the phone in due time when management calls or returns our email. So disappointed, especially as we have enjoyed fabulous meals at other locations all over the world as Jean Georges is a favorite of ours.  Never have we experienced something like this.  Just several weeks ago we visited Topping Rose in Bridgehampton NY and it was perfect!! 
Still astounded this was a Michelin.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Hard to know where to start. We were not informed of price set menu ahead, totally over priced and inappropriate for our group.  Made the best of it and ordered.  Drinks took 40 minutes to arrive at the table, and food arrived at the same time.  The steak was gamey and inedible, was too raw, they offered to cook more but it wasn‚Äôt seasoned or prepared so that seemed pointless.  Truffle pizza was good, but looked disgusting, brussel sprouts mushy, salmon dry.  The waitress was lovely-but advised us against the set NYE menu option in favor of al a carte which was still $190 euro per person.  The DJ began at 9pm and was atrocious volume, multiple tables complained and a speaker was moved. Would never go back or advise anyone to dine there, holiday or not. Total bill was about $1200 euro and terrible.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Food was amazing, unfortunately there was no indication of the pricing as reviews and Google say that per head meals typically cost around ‚Ç¨80. Upon arrival we received the menu which was ‚Ç¨200+ per head + wine on top. This was disappointing for us that they could have at least given an indicator of this.

Service was very slow, they brought out the wrong knives and smashed plates. They were nonetheless friendly, just not good enough for what we paid.

Ambience was poor, we had no privacy and felt like we were being watched from both sides as it was a very crammed table area we were sat at.

Music was awful - I DJ myself and I can hear when mixing technique is poor. They would increase the volume on one song and fade the other out which meant that the music would just suddenly get louder, increasingly so that we couldn‚Äôt hear each other talk and enjoy the moment.

Food was incredible none the less, it did take ages to get our wine served and for the food to arrive however. It‚Äôs a shame although without it, this review would be 1*.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
