Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Had a great time at Market - wait staff amazing. Pizza delicious and Brussel sprouts pesto pasta a great choice for be as a vegetarian. Lots of vegetarian options and they would modify dishes for me. Family loved chicken samosas and tomato soup.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
2nd visit, another poor experience with wait staff.  Food was good, but slow to arrive at table.
I like this place for its food and ambiance but have lower my expectations regarding service.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Very nice restaurant, elegant, great food and very good services. 
Always keeps track of allthe above itens.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Ein tolles Restaurant nicht unweit der Champs-√âlys√©es. Nette Bedienung, sch√∂nes Ambiente und hervorragendes Essen.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Very nice find.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: It was my birthday at market and the food and service was absolutely exceptional.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: I would recommend this place for business lunches, it is good and quiet

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Absolutely amazing, The staff was so kind and accommodating. It was my boyfriend and Is anniversary of three years and they were so kind and gave us a free piece of cake. Great experience.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Dined at this restaurant to celebrate my boyfriends birthday and the staff made it very special. Exceptional customer service from the moment we arrived right to the very end. The meal was nothing short of outstanding. Look forward to visiting again when I return to Paris!

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Restaurant tres agr√©able o√π on mange tres tres bien

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Delicious food in a very upmarket location - we had trouble picking dishes as they all sounded so tempting - however the staff really seemed to let this place down. There was a general feeling of disorganization, we waited an age for bread and our drinks order to be taken despite the two tables next to us receiving theirs very early, we had to chase. The wine wasn't terribly cold so they put it on ice for ten minutes but didn't offer us anything else in the meantime. We had to ask twice for the wine. They were a long time taking our order, then quickly brought dishes over to us but they weren't ours, took to another table, wasn't their's etc. etc. there was seemingly no management / ma√Ætre d' in charge and instead a lot of staff that didn't know whether they were coming or going. It is not an inexpensive establishment so guests expect a higher level of service and attention to detail. I would return as the food was great but they should sort their staff out.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: This was the best dinner we had in Paris . We loved it so much we went back on Saturday night . The truffle pizza was amazing . The sushi black plate is one of the best sushi I have ever had . On Saturday we decided to have Beef and lamb chops that were perfect. The service was lovely and the manager came over to see if we were enjoying ourselves . I can‚Äôt wsit to come back .

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Great location in lovely neighborhood.
Great service, food delicious, intredting menu.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Great food/Service, Great ambiance. Will def recommend.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: The food is great and the staff are very nice. I enjoyed every second of the experience.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Super spot in Paris for every palette. There is something for everyone here. The staff is top notch.
The cuisine is innovative and super fresh.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: We had a particularly nice quiet table.  The chicken dish was wonderful.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: As a regular over the years this is usually reliable and the food is neither ‚Äòwow‚Äô nor disappointing. But this visit was marred by well intended but at times very slow service. At this price point this isn‚Äôt acceptable.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Fresh food, good products, same items on the menu since 20 years... lack of innovation and over spicy in some plate...

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: We were in Paris for just 2 days and came across Market and it was excellent!  What made it special was our server, Agathe!  She was vibrant and extremely personable and provided helpful recommendations!

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Went to have a nice meal on holiday. Food was very good and tuna spring roll was exceptional.  Wine was reasonable (forParis). Service was very nice and everyone seemed to be enjoying themselves

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Awesome as always, 4th or 5th time of coming to this restaurant and it never disappoints.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: We went here for our last dinner in Paris before leaving the next day. The wait staff was excellent and the food was fantastic! Each of us had different entrees and starters and each was delicious.  No fails found here.  They even sang ‚ÄúHappy Birthday‚Äù in English to our friend.  Great place!!  Highly recommend!!

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Cuisine originale et bonne. 
Service gentil mais tr√®s long. 
Prix √©lev√©s mais normaux pour centre ville.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Horrible waiter.... my boyfriend ordered the tenderloin medium well. It came out bloody/rare, sent it back to be cooked further. Meanwhile my dinner gets cold. His comes back, still rare, sent it back again along with mine to warm up, they started over on both and his is STILL bloody and red. At this point we‚Äôve been there an hour and fifteen minutes. The waiter finally says he though he wanted it medium rare. All the while we‚Äôve said medium well, just a little pink in the middle. Ugh! Totally wrecked his birthday dinner. I just wanted out and asked for the bill. He disappears, we waited 15 minutes and I finally get asked to the manager. Awful experience

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Another amazing meal at Market. I highly recommend the crispy sushi, truffle pizza & kale salad.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Amazing place 
Very romantic 
Waitress was very nice and accommodating . Dimmed lighting made the place very romantic . Upscale crowd .

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Am always happy to eat at any Jean George‚Äôs restaurant anywhere in the world. There is always something on the menu I like.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: This restaurant has excellent food and ambiance but an unfortunate event sourd the evening (our waiter quit in the middle of the meal) leaving us without dessert or an explanation for some time.  While management‚Äôs gesture ‚Äîa dessert not requested or liked by the birthday girl‚Äî was brought to the table is  was inadequate.  Disappointed by management, not the food.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Celebrated a 60th birthday and everything was great!  The food was delicious and the staff was very efficient.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text:
Decided to finally have a nice dinner in Paris tonight and thought I could not go wrong with this place. 

Unfortunately the food was ok and the service was bad. Considering we spent 155 euro for two people it was disappointing to say the least:

Service (1 Star)
It took about 10 minutes to take our drink order and another 15 to take out dinner order. We had to ask for bread and our table was tiny and since we didn't order wine you would think to take the wine glasses away. 

Food (2 Stars)
Appetizer
Pistachio Guacamole with Corn Chips was ok. The guacamole had a hint of pistachio which made it unique but crazy for 19 euro. 

Calamari had no taste and needed salt. It was crispy but really bland. 

Main course
Rigatoni pesto and pistachio was good and pasta was cooked nice

Beef tenderloin was ordered medium rare but came medium to medium well. Because it took so long I ended up not complaining and finished the dish. The sauce and the brussel sprouts and gravy were great but as I tried to finish the beef it got tougher with every bite. The gravy and brussel sprouts saved some of the dish

For dessert we ordered the lemon almond cake and it was ok. Could not discern the lemon not the almond. 

We asked for the check and again it took another 30 minutes. 

All in all not sure if we were considered second class citizens because we sat in the bar area but for a JG restaurant it was surprising to be treated to such lackluster service. 

The waiter was nice but I blame management. It seems like just poor attention to detail and lack of training.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our dinner.  Started out quiet at 7:30 PM but soon every table was full and the techno music was turned up and the lights dimmed.  It ended up being our best meal during our stay in Paris.  Loved that it was right next to the Champs-Elysees.  The food was delicious and my lychee and raspberry bellini was wonderful.  We will definitely visit Market when we return to Paris!

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Toujours fan du cadre mais h√©l√†s le niveau sonore beaucoup trop √©l√®ve (musique) et un temps d‚Äôattente tr√®s long entre chaque plat ou demande extra.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Awesome ambiance, great vibe, beautiful food presentation and the clean tastes exquisite!  Thank you for the nice break from Paris traditions - Brasseries and Bistros !

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Very good! Would go back.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: We are visiting from the USA had English menu, very accommodating, great food, great ambiance, highly recommend

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: It was a remarkable experience, with delicious food, ambient atmosphere and outstanding level of service. A bit pricey, but was worth every ‚Ç¨ paid.

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: Great food!

Restaurant_Name: Restaurant Market By Chef Jean Georges
Text: The food, service and vibe were fantastic. It‚Äôs a beautiful restaurant and the food is delicious. We got the crab cake and Parmesan crusted chicken. I‚Äôd highly recommend it for any occasion including special events.
Very good, Very beautiful. Calm atmosphere with friendly staff.
Solid meal, good service. Ask for Oysters, they were not on the menu.
Few dishes on the menu but well executed, good combination of flavors! Very good discovery, I recommend
Good location, quality wine and perfect meal. Pistachio creme brul√© is a must
Nice restaurant with homemade dishes in Montmartre

Restaurant tr√®s cozy & atmosph√®re chaleureuse.
Gentillesse du personnel
Tr√®s bel endroit, h√¥tes formidables, sympathiques et accueillants. Tr√®s bon rapport qualit√©-prix. Tr√®s bonne nourriture et cocktails
Wonderful dining experience for Nee Years Eve. Preset menu was excellent, service lovely and ambiance was lively and fun. Came here back in 2018 and was excited to return. Highly recommend.

Food was really not good and very bland. Menu wasn‚Äôt properly explained. Service was a bit slow. If a menu item is raw, please include it on there so folks are aware. The veal was not cooked tastefully and it was a bad cut of meat. Definitely wouldn‚Äôt recommend this place.
Our dinner was outstanding!! We want to return soon-
Ein besonderes Lokal. Hip und Cool und trendi, w√ºrde ich sagen. Tolle Atmosph√§re, nettes Servicepersonal. Sehr freundlich. Alles G√∂nge waren lecker und gut. Gute Weinempfehlung. Ein toller Abemd.

Creative delicious food! The cod and the escargot were stand out. Staff was warm and friendly and spoke perfect English. Service a bit slow - but restaurant was busy so it made sense.  The interior is charming and inviting and cozy.
Perfect! I couldn't be more impressed with the food.
Wonderful charming little restaurant.   Service and food was excellent!
Amazing!  Will definitely go back. The food was delicious and service was exemplary.
One of our favorites. We eat here every time we are in Paris. Great food, great ambiance and great service.
I had an amazing experience here. Staff was attentive and the food was excellent.

Amazing food: fresh and delicious 
Wonderful service: you guys rock with your hospitality and hosting
I would strongly recommend this restaurant, the food was exceptional and the wine exquisite.  The staff are very chilled and attentive.  5 stars
Great staff, excellent food.  Really enjoyed our dinner.
So much fun at this chic little gem of a restaurant. Food and service were exceptional.
The wait staff and everyone was very nice and the food was outstanding. The Thai peanut sauce on the chicken is a star and the escargot was a masterpiece.

We left after 1 hour and 15 minutes after ordering because the meal NEVER ARRIVED. The manager did comp our drinks as expected. They were disorganized and confused the entire evening. I would recommend a McDonalds in Paris first

everything about the evening was perfect.  lovely warm evening so ssat outside.
wines delicious as was the food.
the service was second  to none. recommend.
Amazing food and incredible wine!  Great way to celebrate our engagement
A wonderful experience from start to finish, delicious food, excellent service and lovely Parisian ambience to enjoy
Beautiful restaurant on a lovely street. The escargot was like nothing I‚Äôve ever had. So delicious. The food was unique and delicious. Wonderful experience.

Tucked away in a quiet neighborhood in Paris, this cute little quirky restaurant had very inspired dishes and excellent cocktails. The servers were beyond nice and prompt. It was just a great vibe with great food; we really enjoyed it.
Too expensive for what we eat. Restaurant empty no wonder why‚Ä¶..

Not as advertised,  this is a hole in the wall that tries to be good.  Dont waste an evening in Paris here.   Open table is the only on filling this place and its all Americans.   DONT GO WE WISH WE HADNT
We really enjoyed the food here.  It was a welcome change from traditional French food. The ambiance is chill. The drinks were excellent.

The food was amazing, the staff was fantastic (both in service and in as overall human beings). they were engaging, witty, helpful, and kind. Everything about this place was wonderful.  I would recommend it 1000%
Great atmosphere and staff, food was excellent and great wine selections.

As I told my server - bring me a sharp razor blade! I'll never have a better meal in my life and I wanted to end it right then and there!!!! No where in America could one find a better prepared and served meal then this gem in the Marias.
AMAZING!!! Ambiance, food, the staff, the owners! It‚Äôs such a find in Paris!
Best restaurant in Paris ‚Ä¶don‚Äôt miss the escargot
Excellent food. Good service. Good wines. A bit pricey
No doubt one of the best meals we had while visiting Paris.  Great service to boot!  Can't wait to visit again.
Service and food was good but it was loud and felt cramped.
What a lovely restaurant!  The food was delicious and the service wonderful!  The dining room is on the second floor overlooking a quaint street.  We‚Äôll come back the next time we‚Äôre in Paris!
Simple sophistication at its climax is Pamela Pomo. Their offerings and hospitality are organically honest whilst still delicious and filling.

Excellent food, high quality and tasty meal but non pretentious which is great. The cocktails were amazing and the staff really know what they're doing. Overall, great experience and I'd definitely go back :)
The restaurant has a lovely vibe with lots of returnee customers, which is deserved as the food is great.
We had a blast. Intimate, loaded with ambiance and youthful energy, yet easy to hold a conversation. Food was excellent and service too. You will be glad you spent an evening there.

Cannot recommend Pamela Popo enough! The food was amazing, the service was incredible, and all the guys working there were so kind! No one we‚Äôd rather spend NYE with- thank you Benjamin, Warren, and Carl!
Great meal for new year‚Äôs eve!

After a disappointing start, our experience at Pamela Popo was excellent.

My issues were with service the first 20 minutes or so.  The two people who stopped by our table initially seemed disengaged bordering on dismissive.  This stood out after a week of impeccable service at other similar Paris restaurants.  Our primary server the balance of the evening was much better. Also, for a fine dining restaurant, I found having to download the menu to my phone to seriously detract from my fine dining experience.  I think having regular menus available as an option should be bare minimum when in a fine dining establishment. Might make me a Boomer, but its how I feel. :-)

The food was excellent.  Ambiance as well. I would request a table upstairs if you can.  80-90% of the tables are upstairs.  We were in the smaller back room upstairs and that was very nice.
Our favorite dinner in Paris

My wife and I had an awesome dining experience for our first evening‚Äôs dinner in Paris. We started with a bottle of Cheval Noir from Bordeaux which was an outstanding wine selection. For our appetizer, we ordered the snails which were exceptional and highly recommended! After a brief debate, we ordered the rib-eye for two for our entree which was absolutely delicious! We finished our meal with the chocolate bomb for dessert which we both enjoyed tremendously! Jeremy was our server who was an amazing treat and quite entertaining. Great ambience, service, and overall dining experience! We definitely recommend paying Pamela Popo a visit which was a hidden culinary gem in this amazing city!

The dinner was AMAZING, everyone is really nice and warm. The personal was outstanding and so great, the food was SOOOOOO good and the prices are fair, they make you feel so much like home!!
They were so welcoming and I truly recommend this place, they really know how to treat their client!!
An amazing place, I will definitely come back here, probably one of the best places in PARIS!!

This restaurant is a must. Had dinner Christmas Eve. The beef cheeks were amazing and the chicken w mushrooms awesome as well. Everything including the wine, the pistachio br√ªl√©e, the ambience, and the service was perfection. I am here in Paris for a month and will definitely visit this gem again! Ginger & Ron Weible

We thoroughly enjoyed our Christmas Eve dinner at Pamela Popo. The food was delicious, fast and served so fresh. The pistachio cr√®me br√ªl√©e was probably the best desert we‚Äôve ever had and we were blown away by the fantastic service from their entire staff.

Pamela Popo hit every high mark for us; delicious and innovative cuisine, personal service, and hip, funky vibe.  Far exceeded our expectations, and blew a previous (Michelin Star) experience we had out of the water.  Our absolute favorite dining experience in Paris.  Highly recommended!
Will definitely return as soon as we can. Superb!

Menu delicieux, service sympa!
10/10!!!
Solid French restaurant with great ambiance. Definitely try the escargots‚Ä¶magnifique!
Food was amazing. They seemed a bit understaffed but we‚Äôre very kind. Upstairs was very warm but they accommodated by opening the windows. Overall would recommend.

Had lunch with friends there! It will be remembered as one of the best meals of our lives! Ambiance and service were outstanding! Wine and food delicious! Will be back when in Paris and that speals volumes!
Lovely little eatery. We had a fabulous evening.  The staff was friendly and the food delicious.
Simple bistro with limited offerings
Amazing restaurant, and service. Would definitely recommend!

I went to Pamela Popo on a whim Thursday night because I was flying out of Paris early Friday morning and finally had some time to myself after a long work trip. 

The place is oozing class and modern Parisian sophistication. From its food to its ambiance, Pamela Popo delivers. I had the snails, eggs with mayonnaise and bared tartare, finishing my meal with the beef cheeks bourginon. Everything was delicious, meticulously crafted to paint a picture of what modern French food is. The best part: entire meal was under 100 euros. This is with a cocktail. 

I highly recommend Pamela Popo. The value is top notch and the food spectacular.

My wife and I simply loved everything about Pamela Popo. The food was some of the best we had in Paris and not overly expensive for the quality of the meal and experience. Also they could not have been more friendly and accommodating. We chose to eat outside and when it started to get a little cold and rainy they were more than happy welcome us inside for desert. All done with a smile and laughter for all. When we return next to Paris we will definitely go to Pamela Popo again.

An excellent French restaurant in Paris. Worth the trip via train. A short walk from the train station. The Pea ravioli was excellent.  Beef cheek was great.  The best was the fish dish was the best.   Service was attentive.  Had dinner alfresco.
Muy bueno!!

Awesome experience!! 
Loved everything from the food , the service , the ambiance and pricing was good .

Pamela Popo was one of the highlights of our two day trip to Paris.  The simple menu was perfection and our food was incredible!  The salad, the entree, the desserts‚Ä¶ delicious.  Go!  You will not be disappointed.
We ordered several of the smaller plates and shared. It was all delicious. The gazpacho was lovely and bright and perfect for a hot day.
As an American tourist you have a hard time selecting where to eat on vacation.   We are so glad we chose Pamela Popo!   Excellent!
On behalf of the Will-Burt company I have to say that our business dinner was fantastic. Great & really excellent food & drinks and great service! Thank you for a great night!

We were on our last day in Paris. I had gone through recommended restaurants the previous three days and we wanted an open day to explore and choose something on our own. I looked up some restaurants in the Place Vendome area. I saw a review about this restaurant and there were time openings so I made a reservation. It was a 30+ minute walk from Vendome area but it was well worth the effort. The food was great. I couldn‚Äôt recommend this restaurant more. We loved it! Sat outside and enjoyed Paris!!
Really delicious food with friendly and fast service. Very quirky restaurant atmosphere too.
Great food and service. Asparagus was nicely plated, and cooked to perfektion and beef tartar one of the best I ever had. It‚Äôs somthing else not just another bistro.

Food is amazing.  Try their specialty cocktails.  Whiskey one with flask is one of a kind.
Owners so nice and charming and the atmosphere is special.
Nice place excellent food and service
Excellent modern take on Burgundian food and well worth the trip

En ce mois de janvier avec des temp√©ratures tr√®s fraiches, la petite salle est toute enti√®re sensible √† l'ouverture de la porte d'entr√©e.
Notre table √©tait proche donc pas mal de courants d'air glac√©
Nous avons mang√© les six mezze et nous sommes tr√®s enthusiasts! Bonne cuisine.

Nos remerciements √† Clara pour sa gentillesse et que dire du repas. Meilleur libanais que j'ai eu la chance d'essayer depuis 15 ans √† Paris. Des saveurs exquises, des portions g√©n√©reuses, un choix vari√© et int√©ressant. Nous reviendrons r√©guli√®rement !
The only thing that was great was food, the ambiance and service were basic
Clara was a great and friendly server and the mezzes were spectacular
Excellent food, service and waitstaff.  We got 7 mezze for two people  and it was more than plentiful.
We had the best experience - the food was outstanding we went for lunch and dinner on the same day it‚Äôs a must to go and great services.
As a Lebanese, I can attest that Assanabel in Paris stands among the best Lebanese restaurants! Try their taboule, kebbe, humus, spicy potatoes and vine leaves.

Amazing food and service. Reserved a table for 6 on NYE and it was a fixed menu of hot and cold Mezzeh (appetizers), main dish if mixed grill, and deserts. Every single item served was super delicious and outstanding. The flavor was on point and very authentic. Will definitely go back again when visiting Paris next time.
Wonderful restaurant with charming staff. Food was absolutely delicious. Had the best time celebrating NYE!!
Tr√®s bel endroit , accueil impeccable avec Clara , tr√®s douce et souriante . Restauration excellente , tr√®s tr√®s bon
We loved the hospitality and food here. Our server. Lara was lovely and all of our dishes in the mezze for 3 were delicious.
Tr√®s bon restaurant rien √† redire. Un vrai voyage au Liban avec des plats savoureux.
Amazing restaurant highly recommend. The food and service was astonishing!!üòä

Perfect Food !! Very good service! Fair price!!
We will be back when in Paris
Bonne table libanaise, service chaleureux, nous y retournerons

Tr√®s bonne soir√©e dans ce restaurant. Personnel au top et plats tr√®s copieux et d√©licieux, de m√™me pour les cocktails. 
Merci

Service et plats juste parfait 
Un peu dommage  que les tables soient aussi proches

Une tr√®s bonne adresse √† St Germain ! Ce discret petit restaurant propose une excellente cuisine libanaise. Nous nous sommes r√©gal√©s d'un assortiment de mezze, froids et chauds tous tr√®s bons. Clara, au service s'est montr√©e souriante et efficace. C'est une adresse que je recommande vivement.

Group of 8.
3 x vegetarian Mezza and 5 meat mezza.
Meat eaters did not notice much difference from the vegetarian option!
Whilst quality was fine the quantity was only moderate.
No Zero/Low alcohol option for lager/beer which was disappointing.
Wine options were good.

Overall 4star as still room for improvement on products although service was good.
Lovely place with charming staff.  The food was solid.  A bit heavy on vinegar.
Excellent meal, ordered a variety of mezzes, all were great.
Lovely little spot with some of the best Lebanese food we‚Äôve ever had.
We had a wonderful time. Clara and Saja were delightful servers. The atmosphere of the restaurant is fun and welcoming.

La comida deliciosa en especial el Fattete que es la especialidad de la casa, los meseros muy atentos nos recomendaron que comer y llegamos antes a nuestra reservaci√≥n y tambi√©n nos ayudaron con la mesa
Lovely service paired with delicious dishes. Great value!
Clara our server was very attentive and helpful. Cozy restaurant with amazing food

Kleines, sehr lebendiges Lokal inmitten des wundersch√∂nen 6. Arrondissements. Beste libanesische K√ºche und besonders freundliches Personal. Ganz besonders danken wir Nour & Isaac f√ºr den tadellosen Service.

Lovely restaurant with delicious libanese food and good service.
Reservations are recommended as it is a tiny dining room.

We had dinner here our last night in Paris, after walking by it a few nights before. Clara was wonderful, had good recommendations and made the meal wonderful. The food was amazing. The potatoes were unlike any potatoes I had before ‚Äî and the falafels were amazing. Clara joked ‚Äî these are real ones. And they were great. The lamb was excellent as well. The portions were so big we couldn‚Äôt even make it to dessert. A wonderful meal.
Great restaurant, one of our favorites of our trip to Paris
Wonderful food and service. Fans would be a good idea during the summer.
A family owned business with amazing food and service! Highly recommended!

A very carefully service by Nour.
The location was a little bit hot.
Incredible Mediterranean cuisine. Our waitress Clare was fantastic. Highly recommend.
Nice place with excellent food.  English is primary language of staff and customers.

We loved this experinec for our last night in Paris! The food was wonderful and the ambience of the restaurant fantastic. The staff was so friendly and helpful. My family really enjoyed it and would highly reccomend you go while in Paris. We can't wait to return. Thank you!!
Clara was excellent and the food was most delicious!!!
Superb spot for Lebanese cuisine. We enjoyed the vegetarian mezze for 5 persons (14 dishes to share), crisp ros√©, and baklava!

The food was of a very good quality. Portion sizes were also adequate. Service was quick. Our server Clara was the best. She was very attentive , patient and explained the menu to us in detail. She even went out of her way and got us a fruit platter on the house. Overall great experience.
Very kind wait staff, delicious food. I would definitely go back.
Fabulous place! Love the food and the service. We‚Äôll certainly be back.
Super Service und authentisches Essen. Gerne wieder.
Visiting Paris with my family and Visit this restaurant. It was so nice! The ambiance is really good and the food is excellent. Klara the waitress was also very professional and sweet!
The food was delicious and the service was absolutely amazing! Clara and Zach went above and beyond that they truly care about serving their customers

The star of the experiences - we ate there twice - was definitely Clara, who was charming, helpful (in perfect English) and enthusiastic, but you'll have to hurry to get her before she completes her chemistry studies at the Sorbonne.  Fortunately, the incredibly high quality of the food will doubtless survive her departure.  The mezes were excellent, with pride of place going to the Fattete Assanabel and the Loubia.  The portions are substantial, so we only got to one of the grillades:   the Fatayel Djaj was memorable.  The Lebanese ice cream was a great experience, with a different but attractive texture. The quality/price ratio was ideal.  The location on Rue Jacob is perfect.  (You have to be fairly careful about this - there are two other restaurants called Assanabel in Paris, and I accidentally booked the wrong one and was chided for my non-appearance).
The  food was delicious and the staff were very friendly and helpful. A completely wonderful experience.

There are countless Lebanese restaurants in Paris, possibly more than from any other country. Some are take-out places that focus on street food, some informal cafes. I researched the best Lebanese restaurants and found one close to us in St. Germain, one of the oldest in Paris, called Assanabel, and after a lazy morning, we headed there for lunch. Wow! We ordered six mezzes (small plates), and every one of them was absolutely delicious, with just the right balance of herbs and spices to excite the palate. We orders their house Hummus Assanabel (made with garbanzo beans, sesame oil, lemon, parsley and garlic), Chankliche (a goat cheese salad with herbs, tomato, olive oil), Loubia (haricots verts cooked in a tomato concasse), Moujadara (lentils, onions, rice), Kellage (oven baked pita with halloumi cheese, zaatar, tomato), and Fatayer (spinach beignets with pine nuts and sumac). When we ordered mint tea after our meal, they gifted us a plate of irresistible baklava. This was one the very best meals we enjoyed in Paris.
Sehr sch√∂nes Restaurant mit wirklich sehr guten Essen. Es war alles frisch zubereitet und hatte einen eigenen Charakter
C‚Äô√©tait bien mais un peu cher vu la quantit√© servie.
Clara and Issac were fantastic hosts. Delightful restaurant with terrific Lebanese cuisine. Highly recommend.
Very friendly service. The mezes were fantastic--especially for our group of six. Will definitely come back the next time I am in Paris.
Outstanding food and a wonderful experience!! A must stop during your visit to Paris!!!
Delightful meal. Authentic Lebanese food. Service with a smile. Highly recommended!
Excellent food and excellent service - Clara was great and very professional. Appreciated that they put candles on my daughters dessert for her birthday. We will be back!

J‚Äôai ador√© le restaurant Assanabel ! La cuisine libanaise √©tait d√©licieuse, avec des plats savoureux et bien pr√©par√©s. Le service √©tait √©galement excellent, tr√®s chaleureux et attention√©. Je recommande vivement ce restaurant !

Je tiens √† souligner le service exceptionnel fourni par Clara et Isac. Ils ont rendu notre s√©jour encore plus agr√©able et confortable. Merci beaucoup pour leur professionalisme et leur gentillesse.
Perfect! First time visit!
The foods were great. Nicely portioned, tasty and quick. Service was exceptional- Clara was attentive and wonderful. We will definitely visit again
We ordered the chef selection Mezza for two and all the food was terrific.  The service was perfect.

We dined at Assanabel last night and the experience totally lived up to the expectations created by reading other reviews. The food was fresh & delicious and the portions generous. Our server was delightful- I was later to discover that she is Clara, mentioned by many other reviewers. She is a true asset. When we declined the offer of dessert she asked us to wait a moment- she had a surprise for us. What followed was a beautiful fruit platter. A perfect end to a perfect dining experience! We will certainly return when we next visit Paris.
Fantastic food and atmosphere! Clara, our server, was also incredibly welcoming and kind. Excited to return!
It was amazing! Clara was our server and she was very welcome and welcoming. The food was spectacular!
Spectacular food and service! Try the sausages mezze. And the mixed grill is some of the best we have ever had. And the Lebanese wines will surprise you with how good they are.
Absolutely fantastic experience! We were visiting Paris and looking for restaurants in the St Germain area
Bonne cuisine et de l‚Äôambiance.

I am here in Paris for the first time celebrating my Milestone birthday!!!!  I was looking on OpenTable and came across this JEWEL!!!  Our service from beginning to end was PHENOMENAL!  I am Palestinian so I‚Äôm very picky about Arabic food!  Everything we had was AMAZING!

What‚Äôs more is our beautiful Lebanese waitress Clara was OUTSTANDING!  She was so sweet, courteous, professional, and suggested items we should order for our party of 3!  We had a variety of amazing mazza and the mixed grill of keffta, chicken and lamb. Sooo delicious!!!  We were engaging in conversation with her and felt like we‚Äôve known her forever and she made us feel we could stay all evening‚Ä¶which we practically did. lol. And before she left for the evening, she came to say goodbye to us and wished us a safe and happy time for our remainder of our stay in Paris.

Also they presented me with a surprise assortment of HB desserts and sang Happy Birthday to me AND gave us a complimentary bottle of delicious cut up fruit.

It didn‚Äôt end there!!  In addition the handsome man who gave us our bill was also AMAZING!  So courteous & friendly!  When I mentioned to him, I loved the Arabic song they were playing, I noticed that the music was turned up louder.  We also asked about hookah places and he provided recommendations!

DON‚ÄôT HESITATE!! Make a RESERVATION and ENJOY the entire experience from the ambiance, to the staff and the excellent food!!!

After spending a lovely Sunday afternoon, strolling through the Luxembourg gardens we were greeted at the most perfect little Paris bistro. We were offered a seat inside the restaurant or out on the patio.  We chose inside the restaurant as smoking is allowed at all Paris restaurants. And on the streets.  Just not inside restaurants in buildings.  Service was perfectly relaxed and casual. One thing I learned is that we as Americans expect our check as soon as the dishes are cleared. However, that is not the custom here in Paris. The white staff will allow you to sit and linger as long as you want without bringing you a bill.  For the most part around town the wait staff will leave you alone unless you raise your hand and flag them down. We may consider that rude behavior in the states, but that is the preferred method here on the continent.  
The food is excellent Bistro fair.  My son smashed his cheeseburger in seconds flat.  My wife said the fish burger rivaled anything she has it in Hawaii.  The shoestring fries were hot and crispy.  I had the quarter chicken. It was moist and tender and came with light and fluffy potatoes and a savory sauce.  
Open table lists the dress code as business casual, but the vibe and dress code was way more casual.  
I may not ever make it back to Paris , but if I do I will definitely eat at Le Choupinet again.
Perfect spot to enjoy a quality lunch near the park and close to Latin Quarter!  Sat on the patio, and tight tables and a smoking was only drag.

We found medium rare in Paris to be anything but medium‚Ä¶ And so we started ordering our steaks medium‚Ä¶ And that worked well for us except at this location the steak arrived as well done. It was a good cut of meat and well seasoned and so it wasn‚Äôt the end of the world. The other problem I had is similar to many other places, they are likely understaffed through no fault of their own, and therefore service was abundantly slow. The quality of service was good, it just left us wanting throughout the evening. I would recommend this restaurant and I would go back a second time in hopes that the service and food consistency would go from 4 to 5 stars

Le Choupinet was amazing and such a great find! Our dinner started with cocktails. The cocktail menu was very diverse which was nice and the ones we chose were excellent. When asked for suggestions for desert she suggested an amazing fondant which was to die for. So warm and chocolaty on the inside with vanilla ice cream to go along. The perfect way to end the meal. The ambiance of the restaurant is also very classical French and fun for a night out in the city. We will absolutely return many times to this restaurant, especially given the very reasonable prices.

We went here for Valentine‚Äôs Day from LA. The ambiance of the restaurant was 8/10. It very much felt fun and like a lounge. The music was also on point! 

The food and service on the other hand was another story. We ordered a filet and the truffle penne pasta. The filet was tiny and the pasta was flavorless with the exception of the truffle. Our server mentioned it was their spin on chocolate mousse which was heavy cream with ice in it and chocolate sauce on top. Odd. The food overall was very overpriced, lacked flavor, and generally underwhelming. There was a staff miscommunication as well. When we arrived the hostess mentioned 1 drink was included in the Valentine‚Äôs Day meal and the server mentioned it as well, so we ordered it. We arrived a little late due to the Uber driver so we were worried. Those worries were quickly replaced when we saw the smiles on the faces of the energetic hosts who greeted us at the door. We were sat quickly and our server came right over to introduce himself. His name was Homeboy and I highly suggest you request his section if you come here. Not only was he very attentive, our many request for substitutions and additions didn‚Äôt seem to bother him at all. With a table of three women from the USA (Michigan) I can admit we were a lot to deal with, but Homeboy assured us that he was there for us and he understood that we may not want our food exactly as it was presented on the menu. In addition to our interactions with Homeboy, the manager and other servers were ready and willing to assist us with whenever we needed anything. They even sung happy birthday to me and presented me with a complimentary ice cream Sunday!  We even got a little taste of home  when they played a song by Eminem! Overall, everything at Hard Rock Cafe was perfect. This was an awesome experience on my birthday my first time in Paris that I will never forget!  I highly recommend visiting the Hard Rock Cafe when in Paris!

The restaurant was an embarrassment and should not be allowed to operate whilst being a building site. We booked for 8pm, did not sit down until 8.40pm and there was no explanation. The waiting staff admitted the extraction systems in the open kitchen dod not work, which is why the restaurant felt quite smokey. I sat next to a stud wall that was sealed by yellow plastic tape. The toilets were a disgrace covered in toilet paper, no soap and the hand dryer did not work. There was only one toilet open, it had a bucket to catch water from the leaking roof, scaffolding to keep the ceiling up and a hanging strip light, exposed wires and no ceiling tiles. All in all not a great impression for my first time in HRC Paris. Went to Hard Rock Cafe Amsterdam earlier this year and the Paris one doesn‚Äôt come close to compare. Firstly the prices were ridiculously high, especially considering it was half the price just across the pond in Amsterdam. We were in time for happy hour and they said they couldn‚Äôt give it to us because the till wasn‚Äôt working and so it was ‚Ç¨28 for 2 drinks but next door was only ‚Ç¨11 for two!! Not to mention just to get some water it wasn‚Äôt free like Amsterdam but was an outrageous ‚Ç¨7, it‚Äôs not even a special drink. Food was ok but a bit basic for the price (which was again ridiculous amount- the starters were the same price as the mains!)  and didn‚Äôt compare in portion or presentation to Amsterdam. Had the mac& cheese and it was something a kid could get in a cheap restaurant with pepper in which was really weird. It was also the cheapest thing on the menu at a staggering ‚Ç¨17. The menu also was half the size of Amsterdam and so was really underwhelming with only about 10 items on it, compared to pages and pages at Amsterdam, it was mainly a few burgers and a few other meat dishes  :( . The waiters were helpful but in a hurry to get you out of the restaurant when it wasn‚Äôt busy at all and were speaking super loud to other tables so we could hear every conversation which wasn‚Äôt needed. Felt a bit let down considering how good the Amsterdam restaurant was compared to this one.

Me and my partner booked a table for 9pm as a birthday meal and when we were greeted, we had to wait for our table, even though we had booked.

We were taken to our seat and our drinks were ordered. Along came our waiter 5 minutes after and we proceeded to order the shrimps for starter and a burger and open sandwich for our mains.

We were sat directly opposite the grill area and watched meals be sat around for 10 minutes as no one was taking these to the tables.

Our starter was sat on the side for 10 minutes under no heated lighting until it was eventually brought over to us. 

Once we had finished our starters, no one came over to take away our plates or offer us anymore drinks, as ours were empty.

In the middle of waiting for our mains our waiter David came over and apologised that he had disappeared, advising that on one of his tables a note had been left saying ‚Äòhelp me‚Äô so he had to investigate this.

After a half an hour wait and our meals sitting around for a further 5 minutes they brought over to us. We were not asked if we wanted any extra drinks or sauces so we had to ask a waiter separately for this.

My partners open sandwich was Luke warm and after our waiter coming over 15 minutes after, once my meal had been finished, he offered a new meal, however my partner declined as he would then be eating on his own.

At the end of our meal my partner went to see a manager and asked for our bill to be revised as we were not happy with the service or the food.

After only taking the one meal off, my partner went to speak to the manager again, who started laughing at my partner and speaking in french to his colleague who again kept laughing and smirking. The manager was extremely rude and kept arguing with my partner. Our waiter also denied coming over to us regarding the note, and lied infront of us.

I showed up at the restaurant and the door keepers said open table is not part of their reservation network. Then they proceded to physically remove me and my companion from the doorstep even though it was heavily raining, and dismissed any further communication after that, even though we could prove from the wide windows at the restaUrant that there were tables available. Never have i been so mistreated by staff in my life. Thankfully, the people at the Mandarin were most kind and welcomed us without a reservation, which was tough for a Saturday night. I strongly encourage all potential customers to stay away fron this restaurant.
Service and food were both great! What a hip spot! There was a DJ playing cool music. Ambiance was super chill. Burrata was amazing. Seabass and baby chicken was great! Worth a try!

Never again. I had the worst experience in my life. While I was having my drink I noticed something strange in the glass - it turned out to be an old receipt in the ice cube! When I complained, their reaction was just to bring a glass  of different wine. It goes without saying that I couldn‚Äôt enjoy my dinner after the incident.
Only reason I gave a 4 instead of 5 was because the music was too loud. My ears were ringing after leaving.

Had a very bizzare experience at Mamamia. I booked a table for my birthday to have dinner with the party and DJ that Mamma Mia typically has. They refused to sit me upstairs and insisted on sitting me downstairs even though there was barely anybody sitting upstairs. They told me all of the tables were reserved. They also told me they can‚Äôt make any promises about where you will be sitting but clearly made exceptions to other people about sitting them upstairs? I told them I booked this dinner for my birthday and I wanted to sit upstairs and they told me maybe after I eat, I can sit upstairs. Then they tried to tell me after dinner if I wanted to sit upstairs, I would have to pay a minimum of $300 to buy a bottle for a VIP experience, which I didn‚Äôt have to do the last time that I was there. Part of me thought they were trying to take advantage of me because I was an American. overall did not have a great experience this visit. Maybe it is just hit or miss. The food was very good but the drinks were terrible.
Excellent food and amazing vibe the place one of a kind.

not a great atmosphere, we where alone at a friday night with a few other tables. The waiter was litterally waiting next to our table to see when we finished our plate, very awkward. would not recommend it, felt like a tourist trap

Entertainment starts late, don't make a booking before 9.30 because you do get kicked off the table and are not allowed to enjoy the dj etc. was taken down to the club and when I left there was many tables in the restaurant that were empty but the staff still didn't allow me and my friend to sit there

Very high energy, club type experience. Waiters were good but too busy. Food was not what it should be for the price. Fun night but not worth it.

Friendly staff upbeat environment and tasty dishes. Music was a bit loud but we loved the atmosphere. Truffle Rigatoni was incredible!

Amazing experience. However, our server had us waiting 10 minutes before providing a menu. When the menu was provided we were left for another 20 minutes waiting to order. Incredible food and ambiance.  The romantic candlelit vibe is a great accompaniment to the extraordinary service and food.  Before or after your dinner, be sure to grab a cocktail or champagne in their downstairs ‚Äúspeakeasy‚Äù like bar/cocktail club.

Note/Pro Tip: We added truffle to everything, as you can see from our photos!

We took a chance on this place based on the reviews but was severely disappointed as it‚Äôs clearly geared towards impressing tourists that don‚Äôt know any better. The menu looks good but the taste of the food falls flat. For this price you can eat at dozens of other places in Paris where the food is worth the money. After a pretty bad meal I asked for the check and when I paid I was asked by the server to tip her! I was dumbfounded. Tips are not part of eating in restaurants in Europe and only unknowing Americans feel compelled to do so. I found this to be offensive and the last straw in what was a very disappointing night out. Stay away from this place and find one of the other hundreds of restaurants in Paris with better food and servers who aren‚Äôt asking for a tip.
Excellent service by our server!! Just Superb!

Food was unreal!! Decor was gorgeous. Great service. We booked at 9pm but could have done with a table a little later as it started getting busier and more fun around 10:30/11pm. Vibe was great we really enjoyed this!
Wonderful dinner on our last night.  Highly recommend the tiramisu.

We had an amazing time! The only downfall is we had such a tiny table for the three of us and I was on the awkward part of the table. Wow wow wowwww! One of the best nights of our lives! We originally had a booked a table at another ‚Äòfestive‚Äô Paris restaurant, however we weren‚Äôt happy with that so we ended up making a very last minute reservation at mamamia.

Every single staff member there was so smiley and so attentive and just generally fun, even the DJ was so entertaining! . Mama Mia is one, if not the best restaurants we‚Äôve ever been to. Paris, we love you! Everything TikTok says about this restaurant being amazing, is true! This is your sign to go there. We loved it so much we‚Äôre going again tonight!

Staff was so rude. Hosts were rude, out of line and not dressed appropriately for such an expensive restaurant nor for Christmas weekend. We were at the restaurant for almost 4 hours because the service was slow, our food was cold, waited 25 minutes for silverware, and then had to wait an extra 30 minutes just to retrieve our checked coats. The hostess refused to hand us our jackets saying thats not her job, made us stand there in the way of everything all while other people handed her their coats. She was also rude to the family next to us. Seriously unacceptable, especially on Christmas Eve.

Very nice and cosy restaurant and the food is fantastic! Please try their truffle pizza! The service is very good as well!!! My biggest recommendations to Mamamia.

We loved this place! The food, the service, the entertainment- everything was superb:-) we highly recommend it to anyone that wants to have fun and happy evening!! Thank you Mamamia for making our experience special.

We‚Äôve been in Paris for three days and have had incredible meals with incredible service. Our experience at Mamamia was not pleasant. We started by ordering two bottles of wine for a group of six people. She immediately told me that a sweeter wine would be better. I am a wine collector so know what I like. She insisted on opening a sweeter wine. We didn‚Äôt like it and ended up going with our original order. When she went to pour the wine, she poured on the table, on two people and into a water glass with water. We then placed our food orders. She forgot one of the orders and that order didn‚Äôt come out until after the rest of the party was done with their meals. Before dinner, we ordered a red wine to accompany dinner. When the wine came out she tried to pour the test glass into our existing white wine glasses. We had to ask for different glasses for our red wine. When the bill came it clearly stated that service was included(see attached). After the bill was paid she came back and said that she did not receive gratuity and asked us to pay more. In addition, the music was so loud that you could not talk across the table. Overall this was an awful experience. If you are an American, avoid this place. They will come after you for unearned gratuity and treat you as lower citizens.

One translation of the restaurant's name would be "hidden."   And it is a bit out of the way.  But it offers good eclectic small dishes at a very reasonable price. It was like walking out of a movie theater because the movie was **that atrocious**. We literally had to bail after appetizers. 

This restaurant barely gets 2 stars overall due to reservation booking mishap (opentable‚Äôs fault?), frankly horrendous food, and the flippantly dismissive attitude of the staff (and I totally understand restaurant service in Paris is different than in the US). Ambiance inside the restaurant is kitschy-swanky-cozy, so I‚Äôll give them that. 

I made a reservation three weeks in advance for a casual, romantic dinner with my sweetheart for 6:00pm on a Wednesday. Reservation was confirmed for 6pm, online menu looked beyond delicious, we were excited. Open table included instructions that our reservation would be forfeited if we were more than 15 minutes late. With that said, we arrived a few minutes early. 

We walked up to the restaurant and spotted only one guy around lounging on one of the outdoor banquettes. He literally could not be bothered to make eye contact with us because swiping right and left on his phone was more enticing than doing his job. 

‚ÄúWhat you want me to do? No one in the kitchen until 19:00‚Äù (sans eye contact) was the only explanation we received at all about our 18:00 reservation (6:00pm). So we waited . . .for well over an hour . . . We upheld our end of the reservation by showing up on time, the restaurant didn‚Äôt do the same. 

Fast forward to after the lounger/phone swiper/waiter? could be bothered to take our dinner order . . . the appetizers were awful by EPIC proportions. 

We ordered two appetizers, because frankly we were hungry after that hour wait: 

1.a crawfish appetizer that may have contained crawfish, but I can‚Äôt confirm. It was just a soggy, sad mess. 

2. The other appetizer we ordered were chicken tenders that were overcooked in a ‚Äúis this someone‚Äôs pinky finger?‚Äù sort of way. After ANOTHER 30 minutes, my husband checked on the entree we ordered, and guess what? Yep, still not sent to the kitchen.

This restaurant was so beautiful and inviting, but the food just wasn't right. Their english menus had poor translations so it was hard to understand fully what the dishes were even with an explanation from the waitress.

The burrata with asparagus was served in a ball without proper oil dressing and on top of a hard tomato with no asparagus whatsoever. The tuna tartare was asian styled with a giant salad on top and green beans on the side instead of one combined dish. In all, the food execution was just not there.

This restaurant looked quite good online, but was a huge disappointment. I have a restaurant background and generally don‚Äôt post negative reviews, however for the prices they are charging I feel others should have the heads up as to what caliber experience they can expect here. We split a tuna tartare to start, which included rice crispies (ie puffed rice). This is the first time ever I have come across the use of rice crispies in a recipe at a restaurant. The tartare was also unusually sweet. I typically don‚Äôt send things back, but this was priced I believe at 24 euro and was pretty bizarre. For main courses, my friend ordered the lamb, which was underwhelming at best. I ordered the lobster roll that was described as coming with chips. I expected this would be of the French fry variety, however they were actually potato chips. As a side note, washrooms and overall cleanliness was also not great. Posting pics of the previously mentioned tuna tartare and lobster roll. Spend your money elsewhere, this is crazy overpriced and would not even be of basic pub level quality, so if you‚Äôre looking for something special this is not it.

Great food, great service, off the beaten track. Would recommend trying the 'secret' cocktail! We were there two weeks ago to celebrate our anniversary - the outdoor area is nicely decorated, cosy and romantic. Loved the atmosphere and friendly service!

We was here for my fiance Birthday on Saturday evening. Such a very beautiful place !!! 
Service by Marion was superb and the ambiance lovely. Perfect restaurant for a date.
Long gaps between waiter checks.  The food was NOTHING as it was described.  Nothing special at all. The fish was the boniest y have ever had.

Beautiful restaurant on an out of the way side street with a true Parisian vibe. Live greenery creates a lush backdrop to outdoor, covered dining. Inside, intimate tables and eclectic decor enhance your dining experience - candles burn brightly on each table from whimsical quail candleholders. Enough about the look of the place - the food was fabulous! We had the marinated beef and the turbot after a wonderful appetizer of avocados, mangos, and crawfish. The beef was cut with a fork tender and melted in your mouth. The sauce was amazing. The fish was tender and perfectly cooked. Again, the sauce was brilliant. The owners are young and happy - speaking several languages including English and French. Don‚Äôt miss out on this neighborhood gem when you are in Paris - Inavou√© won‚Äôt leave you undeclared - you‚Äôll give it 5 stars, too!

Cozy and intimate restaurant in the heart of Paris; ideal for dinner or drinks. There are only a handful of interesting restaurants near Place Du March√© Saint-Honor√©, and Inavou√© is a place you‚Äôll find yourself always going back to. Lots of healthy cuisine. Not to mention, it is also perfectly hidden from all the other restaurants in the area.

Reported me as 'no show'. Had to prove attendance with information from the check.  No excuse from the restaurant.

We had a memorable and fantastic dinner here on our first night in Paris.  There is so much good food in this city but our meal at Le Manifique really stood out.  The cocktails were superb, my scallops were some of the best I've ever tasted and the tuna my wife had crusted with sesame seeds was wonderful.  But the French toast dessert was to die for and probably ruined french toast for us forever as it will be hard to beat.  All of this was served in a sexy fun atmosphere with the waiter dj'ing some fantastic Motown through 90s soft hip hop classics.  Overall this was our favorite dinner in Paris and I'd highly recommend!

We could not review properly as we arrived and the restaurant was closed due to trouble in Paris. We were not informed so travelled across Paris to find the restaurant locked up with no one answering phones. We found somewhere else to eat that was open. Disappointing communication.

We were in town visiting on holiday and booked this place because it was under the ‚Äúcasual‚Äù dining with only ¬£¬£ money signs but when we got there they were acting like it was a black tie affair. To spend ¬£20 on 5 cheese sticks is absurd. My husband & I split a main course because the prices were surprisingly expensive. Was also disappointed with the portions compared to the high cost.

The worst part was we had the chicken & mushroom dish and the sauce as well as the chicken arrived COLD. The fact that it was served in a skillet yet arrived under temperature was concerning. The flavor was good but for the cost, we should not have had cold food.
I would not recommend this place when there are SO SO many other options‚Ä¶be prepared for pretentious servers as well as an expensive bill.
A delightful experience! Warm, friendly, cozy! Our last dinner in Paris so we ate at 7pm‚Ä¶early for Paris! They were understanding and certainly eager to please! Charming!
Great atmosphere, food, music and service. I will be back!

All of this was served in a sexy fun atmosphere with the waiter dj'ing some fantastic Motown through 90s soft hip hop classics.  Overall this was our favorite dinner in Paris and I'd highly recommend!

We could not review properly as we arrived and the restaurant was closed due to trouble in Paris. We were not informed so travelled across Paris to find the restaurant locked up with no one answering phones. We found somewhere else to eat that was open. Disappointing communication.

We were in town visiting on holiday and booked this place because it was under the ‚Äúcasual‚Äù dining with only ¬£¬£ money signs but when we got there they were acting like it was a black tie affair. To spend ¬£20 on 5 cheese sticks is absurd. My husband & I split a main course because the prices were surprisingly expensive. Was also disappointed with the portions compared to the high cost.

The worst part was we had the chicken & mushroom dish and the sauce as well as the chicken arrived COLD. The fact that it was served in a skillet yet arrived under temperature was concerning. The flavor was good but for the cost, we should not have had cold food.
I would not recommend this place when there are SO SO many other options‚Ä¶be prepared for pretentious servers as well as an expensive bill.

We were in Paris for a week from Canada, to celebrate my husband and daughters birthdays. We were also joined with other family members from the UK. 

When last in Paris 15 or 20 years ago it seemed like every little restaurant,  brassiere or patisserie we went to had excellent food. This time was so different - the only place that was vaguely good was the local patisserie around the corner from our hotel. It seems many of the restaurants in Paris are now parts of big chains and the quality of the food has sadly declined. We had not had one really good meal our whole time and were feeling quite disappointed as we had so been looking forward to great food - especially the night of our birthday celebration.

Then on our last night in town we went to L'Entente. Being mostly Brits, we weren't sure this was the place to go in Paris but were we ever glad we did! This place is spectacular. It's only been open 4 months and 8 days - as told to us by the delightful owner Oliver, but it is already a gem of a place to go. It's beautifully appointed, staff is exemplary but the best part is the food. Everyone's meals were outstanding - from starter to dessert. 

I wish I had taken better pictures - the place is much prettier than my pictures show. Also should have taken pictures of the food - especially before half eaten - but oh that gingerbread and caramel sauce was soooo good! 

A big thank you to L'Entente for a fabulous last meal in Paris!

Restaurant_Name: Le Coq & Fils ‚Äì Chef Antoine Westermann (anciennement Le Coq Rico)
Text: Restaurant states to notify them of food allergies prominently on their menu. I notified my server I have a dairy allergy and went over every item I order to make sure it cleared it. He confirmed everything I ordered was dairy free. For my final dish, dessert, I ordered a chocolate sorbet and lime sorbet. He brought me vanilla ice cream and chocolate ice cream. I took a bite of what I assumed was lime sorbet when I immediately realized it was vanilla ice cream. I immediately spit it out into my napkin and notified the server and manager/host. But to my chagrin, the level of professionalism of how it was handled by management was embarrassing for the establishment. You didn‚Äôt just mess up an order, you put someone‚Äôs life in jeopardy and acted if it could be fixed with serving a new dessert. Still in shock about the low level allergy hazard response. I ran to the bathroom trying to rinse it from my mouth. Your management handled that awfully. I give a little more credit to the server because he sought me out after I came out of the bathroom to send his apologies. We left without management acknowledging it. Just awful and unacceptable

We were so disappointed, especially since we had such a spectacular visit just two months ago.

Was really looking forward to this reservation as it was a really special occasion for us and we had travelled from the UK to be in Paris for NYE to surprise my brother in law. When we arrived on NYE, we were first told we didn‚Äôt have a reservation and then when we showed them this booking, were sat on a table which was clearly not a dining table which felt a bit strange and like we were trying to be made to feel unwelcome. A menu was brought to us, and before saying anything else, the server pointed to the ‚Äò‚Ç¨200 pp‚Äô notice at the top. This price a TOTAL surprise to us, and when we asked if there was the usual menu which we‚Äôd seen online, we were told there was only one menu as it was NYE. 

We had not been informed that this was the case prior to our booking and I had received multiple emails in the run up to the booking which would have been a perfect time to mention it surely? Nothing had mentioned it on their website either.

Online in other reviews it states that the usual dining experience is around ‚Ç¨50pp and had we have been informed that it was ‚Ç¨200 each on NYE, we wouldn‚Äôt have booked it and wasted our time. 

Just seemed like they didn‚Äôt want us in the restaurant and clearly didn‚Äôt have space/had overbooked. Can‚Äôt comment on the food as we left before we ate, only then to have to find somewhere else to eat at 7pm on NYE (nightmare!) Luckily, after wandering for a while we eventually found a lovely restaurant which was a quarter of the price and incredible food and service. So glad we didn‚Äôt dine at Yacatan after this rude reception. 

Although the interior looked incredible and I‚Äôm sure the food is great (should be for this price!), the vibe was cold and obnoxious. Not the warm, hospitable atmosphere we‚Äôd received every other place we‚Äôd visited in Paris. So disappointing! Definitely check before you dine so you aren‚Äôt caught out like we were.
The ladies who check you in are prejudice. I have no words. Horrible experience, horrible!

So happy we found this place. The food was absolutely amazing. The staff was friendly. And they even had live music which we didn‚Äôt expect. We went to celebrate a birthday and it turned out to be the perfect place to have a festive and delicious celebratory meal! Will definitely be back.

Fantastic seafood dishes - great chefs and service!! Highly recommended

It was busy for a Sunday night and 1 waiter. However, he was efficient and pleasant. The classic ceviche was very good and the Lomo Saltado was very tasty. My only critique was the Arroz con Leche, I felt the rice could have been cooked longer as it was a bit hard. Overall, it was an enjoyable dinner!
Great food and setting. I would have rated higher but we were rudely rushed out when it got late.

Went here for my husband's 60th birthday while we were vacationing with our kids in Paris. The food is wondering and you can't beat the view of the Eiffel Tower. Be sure to ask for patio seating though, if the weather is appropriate. My only complaint is that there were quite a few smokers sitting nearby, but it was for the most part, fine. Highly recommend coming here for a special occasion.
Absolutely exquisite. We came for champagne and caviar and enjoyed the beautiful ambiance and decor. The staff was professional and friendly. It was a fantastic birthday! Thank you!
INCREDIBLE

The staff is attentive, and the ambiance is beautiful...

For vegetarian preparations, however, the taste is average - the vegetarian option could have more heat, and flavor. The server informed us that the Pad Thai could not be made spicier. That was disappointing to hear.

Super overpriced for what the food is. We were beyond disappointed as it was our last meal in Paris before we flew home. 218 bucks for cheap tasting noodles you can get at any Chinese place and fish that basically just had hollandaise on it.
The service was not good at all and the food overprice for its quality
We loved the food and the politeness of the workers. The atmosphere is really classy.
Our server was lovely and the food delicious. Nice, quiet ambiance in a luxury hotel.

My young daughter and I were in Paris to celebrate her birthday and I organised many lovely meals in the finest restaurants, this being one of them. When we arrived the male server assumed we were visiting with a pre paid ‚Äúdeal‚Äù which the glass of champagne I had ordered wasn‚Äôt a part of. I had to explain I had not made this kind of reservation. 

The service went from bad to worse. A sprite took 45 mins to arrive, and a second glass of champagne took so long that after having taken more than two hours to have lunch, I had to cancel the glass. How does it take 40 mins to bring a glass of champagne? 

Such a shame. The garden is beautiful but the service here leaves A LOT to be desired.

This was our 5th Anniversary and first time in Paris. The server was very very sweet and the girl manager too. The food is sooooo delicious that I didn‚Äôt ever wanna leave. This restaurant is a 10/10. I would strongly recommend this place to anyone and everyone who is celebrating a special day.
Hermoso lugar y atenci√≥n la pasamos incre√≠ble
Awesome food, beautiful restaurant and decor, service is without fault

Visited for my girlfriends 30th birthday.

Food was amazing and the service outstanding. They even provided us with a selection of cakes for her birthday with a candle and birthday message! Would recommend highly to go back
Excellent food and beautiful place! Only thing is that we had to ask the waiter a few times to get wine and water refills.
The food was not up to par for this caliber restaurant. Very disappointed!
Anniversary

Worst experience we had in Paris and would not recommend this restaurant.  Food was just ok but the owner ruined our NYE.  We were charged $400 for 4 children who did not eat dinner after being told at the beginning of dinner we were NOT going to be charged.  They were looking to scam foreigners from the US.  Stay away from this place.  We were sat in the back of the place and with horrible seating/furniture.  Horrible experience and not kid friendly.  Take your money somewhere else.

The food here was good and the venue is very very nice. I do not believe the food was worth the price and for wine the cost was pretty high even for the lowest cost bottles, there is plenty of good wine for a fraction of the cost that restaurant and the food was good as I said just not worth the high prices. You can get better food and wine for a small fraction of those prices elsewhere. Staff and venue were 10/10
La comida y el lugar dej√≥ mucho que desear. La persona que nos atendi√≥ muy amable
NYE dinner for our family of 5. It was a set menu but plenty of options. Japanese Asian inspired. Food was delicious.

We had the New Year tasting menu and had a terrible experience. One of the appetizers was bland, so we requested a change. The server agreed and took the plate, then returned and placed the plate BACK on the table, stating the kitchen refused the return. He spoke to the manager, who also refused. The order was finally changed when we insisted we speak to the manager, though he never came out. The service was incredibly slow, taking 3 hours for a pre-set menu for 3 people. The steak was way overcooked (medium well for a medium rare order). We also heard the table next door complain of the same thing. We were hesitant to send it back based on our experience with the apps. The only positive comment was that 2/3 entrees were good and the dessert was excellent. I'm not sure it was worth sitting for an extra hour to order them, though. Poor service, inconsistent and bland food, is not worth the price.

This has to be the worst food I‚Äôve ever eaten in Paris. The staff was nice but slow and our main server had dirty finger nails. As far as the food, I couldn‚Äôt taste any alcohol in my martini, the ‚Äúdumplings‚Äù disintegrated at the touch and became mush that stuck to the plate, and the bed of greens with the main course was wilted and brown. This place is far too expensive for what is third-rate catering food.
Christmas dinner! Food was delicious!
Horrible service.  Food was blah.  Whole thing feels like it‚Äôs built for instagram not an actual good dining experience .
Beautiful ambiance. Great service. Food and cocktails were fabulous.
I was on my first trip to Paris celebrating my 40th birthday. Everything was absolutely amazing! I can‚Äôt wait to visit again.
Everything was great. Only negative was the room temperature, VERY warm

The singer and song choices for us were great.. he really tried hard to make everyone enjoy the evening and almost personally sang to every table whilst putting on a show. Defo made the evening better!
Food was good too, not quite 5 star but was still very nice
What a wonderful restaurant. Will visit again when in Paris !

Amazing celebratory dinner.  Great fresh food, especially wonton soup. Fun, live music.  The BEST service in Paris! 
This is a must try restaurant!

Lovely restaurant with good service, albeit a bit hectic. Food good but severely overpriced. None of the extras (amuse bouche/petit fours etc you would expect at this price level. Restaurant while beautifully designed could use touchups here and there.
Nice restaurant, big portions.

We are visiting from the US and this was our favorite restaurant we have been to in Paris so far! We were looking for something different from French food and the Asian fusion was to die for! It‚Äôs definitely a hot spot and the food was so good!!
Amazing food and ambiance. Chicken is great
Good service and excellent foodüëç

We arrived and weren‚Äôt greeted until 10-15 minutes later (with a reservation) and were given a two seat table in a very inaccessible area. I wrote a request in open table asking for two glasses of champagne upon arrival, this did not happen. I then asked for a glass of champagne to sip on while we waited another 15 minutes for a table and I was handed a Riesling in a champagne flute‚Ä¶ the table beside us was seated TWICE and both parties walked out after not being greeted or offered beverages. It looks like it could be a really cool place and the entrees looked good around us but we didn‚Äôt have the chance to try anything.
We arrived at the restaurant to find a sign saying it was closed for construction and renovation. So it was not a good start for my birthday dinner. Not impressed.
I booked my reservation same-day using OT and when I arrived they told me they could not accommodate my reservation and turned me away because they were full.
Beautiful food, great atmosphere

I had to be in Paris over the weekend and booked this restaurant as a solo diner. The front of house staff were incredulous that I was a party of one, which was not a super start, they questioned how I had been able to make the booking, and then told me I could only have the table for an hour - I ended up staying beyond that time and was not asked to leave. The waitress was great and the food was delicious but it took forever to arrive (which led to me staying beyond the hour I was told I could have the table for). Basically: don‚Äôt go here as a solo diner.

We had an incredible experience at Paillettes!! The energy of the second dinner seating on Saturday night was unmatched. Great place to start a night out - great food, great drinks, and great music. The DJ got everyone out of their seats and dancing together! The service was top notch as well, especially from the bartender Orlando and the host Pablo. We loved this place and will definitely return the next time we are in Paris.

The food was great.  We had the poulpe with sweet potato and the vegetarian salad, plus hummus and another spread.  It was all fantastic.  The restaurant is charming looking with exposed stone walls and reddish orange chairs.  We were there on a Tuesday night so the sound level was good, but I understand they play music on weekends, so maybe it is louder then.  We would definitely go back.
The staff and the owner was amazing. They were pleasant and sweet. Restaurant is beautiful
Great place!

This place it‚Äôs so beautiful ! 
The food is amazing try baklava and octopus üòÜ

Magic moment at this place !  üòÉ
The food is really incredible th√© mood is crazy.

There are times when as a diner - you think you may have stumbled on something good that no one else knows about. We booked this restaurant on Open Table and noted it was pretty new but thought the menu was interesting. 

Anyway we arrive and realise something was a bit odd. There was a singer - dj and guitarist but no guests. We were not sure of our decision but we‚Äôre taken to our table after some confusion. After a while we discover this is their first night - although we were made to feel like intruders not welcomed at all. We ordered hoping the welcome and the random ambience would improve (music volume was so loud we asked for it to be reduced twice). Our waiter was distracted and not on it. Remember we were the only people in the restaurant at the time. We ordered the lamb ( great but not warm enough). Then our deserts came - and life became more surreal . My desert looked good and tasted ok until I discover the remains of a plastic sachet in the food ! We complained and the owner came a few minutes later and said the chef apologised‚Ä¶a sort of partial apology. They offered to remove the desert cost from our bill but nothing else ! No free glass of wine nothing. I refused another dish. While my wife was finishing her desert our waiter presented the bill without myself of my wife asking for it. It was a surly action almost trying to get us to leave.

By this stage there were a few more diners in the restaurant- a lady near us had a scarf on her chair - it fell onto the floor. The Maitre De walked past it and left it - I then alerted the grateful guest after he had moved on. 

Finally after this most strange of evenings - we got up to leave. No one came over to talk to us - as we walked out no one said goodbye out of 4 staff we passed ( all of which we has spoken to ). We then tried to leave the restaurant the door would not open ( internal electric ) we waited a couple of minutes for the owner to realise our plight and let us out.

In one word terrible.
